column2: The Vendor Manager will be responsible for developing and owning the strategy for a category, and working with a high performing vendor management team. Within this role the individual will have the opportunity to establish and maintain strong vendor partnerships, manage category profitability, optimize pricing, and identify means to improve the customer experience.     This is a seasoned business leader with a broad skill set which demonstrates analytical capability, excellent business judgment, strong vendor management and negotiations skills, deep curiosity to uncover how things work.   Roles and Responsibilities      Vendor Managers are responsible for managing inputs (selection, in-stock), category or brand financials, pricing and promotion management, auditing and analysis of data at granular levels, vendor escalations and concise communications.         Dive Deep into inputs and understands the downstream impact of changes to pricing, selection, and convenience for multiple subcategories.         Owns the P & L for multiple brands/subcategories; develops plans that drive revenue and margin improvement.         Creates strategic and prioritized vendor business plan that maximizes margins and customer experience.         Vendor Managers are responsible for growing selection, improving terms and cost structures, building long-term relationships with vendors for the sub categories/brands assigned.         Focuses on strategic holdout or challenging vendors to increase selection.         Drives strategic negotiations to deliver top- and bottom-line category growth for sub- categories/brands.         Creates opportunities for growth, customer acquisition for multiple sub-categories.         Vendor Managers are expected to demonstrate customer and category knowledge, be an advocate for a quality customer experience, and understand the competition and industry.         Vendor Managers are responsible for long term growth opportunities and risk identification, planning, communication and partnering with internal teams.         Vendor Managers are expected to demonstrate a deep understanding of tools and become advocates for tool enhancements.         Vendor Managers are responsible for knowledge management, development of self and others, and recruiting.         As such, we expect a Vendor Manager to do the following on a regular basis:         Regular engagements with brands including in-person meetings on a monthly basis         Weekly and monthly review to inspect movements/trends on customer input metrics (selection, customer demand (GV) coverage         Annual and season negotiations with brands         Highlighting escalating issues with brands, competitors to internal leaders and brand leadership         Ensuring vendor experience issues are addressed promptly these could be around access to information/data, payments, MIS reports, promotion plans, etc         Planning for events and promotions including getting support from brands.     Job Specifications      5+ years of experience doing one of several roles: quantitative/financial analysis, retail buying,   retail planning & allocation, product/project management, pricing, marketing or e-commerce.         Proficiency in Excel, Proven analytical skills and highly numerate         Proven Negotiation Skills         Proven experience leading teams & cross-functional projects         Influencing abilities and vendor management experience         Ability to think and react in a high-energy, fast-paced environment         Ability to operate simultaneously and effectively in both tactical and strategic modes         A willingness to roll up sleeves to get things done         The position requires an individual who can work autonomously in a demanding and often   ambiguous environment, with strong attention to detail and effective prioritization         Qualifications :    Graduate in any discipline
column11: Customer acquisition, Analytical skills, Retail planning, MIS reporting, SUB, Financial analysis, Project management, E-commerce, Customer experience, Downstream

column2: We are seeking an experienced and highly organized Account Manager to join our team.                              As an Account Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing and optimizing the operational processes and workflows within our organization.                              Your role will involve streamlining operations, managing resources, and ensuring the efficient delivery of services.                              This is a key leadership position that requires excellent communication skills, strong problem-solving abilities, great project management skills and fanatical focus on customer success                                                          What youll do                                                1.                      Account Strategy Development and Implementation:                                          Develop and implement comprehensive account strategies to enhance productivity,                efficiency, and the quality of customer-focused processes.                        Focus on growth and expansion of customer accounts and internal teams.                              2. Workflow Management and Optimization:                                      Manage and optimize workflows across various departments to ensure the timely delivery of customer-focused deliverables.                        Drive the creation of staffing plans, schedules, and quality/process change initiatives.                                                3. Cross-Functional Collaboration:                                          Coordinate and collaborate with cross-functional teams to align objectives, set performance goals, and monitor progress towards operational targets.                        Leading and managing 3-5 direct reports and 30+ indirect reports.                                                4. Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and Compliance:                                      Establish and enforce standard operating procedures (SOPs) to ensure consistency and compliance with industry standards and best practices.                        Dive into data to identify the root cause of problems and initiate solutions.                                          5. Performance Monitoring and Improvement:                                      Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and operational metrics to track performance, identify trends, and proactively address issues.                        Drive Lean/Kaizen activities to continually improve processes in a fast-paced environment.                                      6. Budget Management:                                  Develop and manage the budget, including forecasting, tracking expenses, and optimizing resource allocation.                        Identify and evaluate potential vendors, negotiate contracts, and manage relationships to ensure the availability of necessary resources and services.                              Requirements            Skills required                          Bachelors degree in business administration, Account management, or a related field. A masters degree is preferred.                                8+ years of work experience as an Account Manager, or in a similar operational role in any services industry who worked with Customers closely.

column2: Perform conceptual, FEED, and detailed analyses and design as per design basis, project specifications, design codes and standards. Develop creative and innovative solutions that are reliable and cost-effective for problems and challenges when they arise. Apply expertise to the most complex problems. Manage own time to meet objectives, and (as Lead Engineer) forecast and plan resource requirements. Develop and manage plans to achieve business objectives. Clearly communicate and explain highly complex ideas and anticipate potential objections; influencing outcomes. When acting as Lead Engineer, in addition: Direct large Engineering team as a Lead Engineer on most unique and complex projects, Lead the Discipline engineering design of the assigned work area and complete within planned schedule and budget, in accordance with standards, MDR and project-specific procedures and to a high professional standard, Plan, organize and direct all aspects of Discipline execution on the assigned project including scope, deliverables, schedule and all manpower resources - agree allocations with the Discipline Manager. Ensure interfaces and deliverables are clearly identified. Maintain responsibility for progress and productivity, identifying any required corrective action. Act as project representative for the Discipline during meetings with Project Team, Customer discipline lead and relevant agencies such as certifying authorities, auditors, third parties, etc.       Essential Qualifications and Education:         Bachelors degree in Naval Architecture, Civil/Structural/Mechanical Engineering. (Masters is a preference)     20+ years in oil and gas with major contractor or consultant predominantly performing detail design     Detailed knowledge of design techniques and analysis methods, and detailed knowledge of the theory, content and application of standards, codes and guidelines as applicable for offshore. Knowledgeable in project coordination and execution skills. Recognized across company as a key lead, highly innovative designer, or highly skilled analyst.         Preferred Qualifications and Education:         Preferably Registered Professional Engineer or member of professional engineering society           Key Tasks and Responsibilities:         Become fully familiar with the project scope of work, specifications, schedule, and all inter-discipline requirements; including identifying concerns as early as practicable and taking appropriate initiatives to address issues, interpret contractual requirements as they relate to engineering execution.     Identify changes to scope and promptly raise change notifications, including providing any necessary supporting documentation and estimates. Provide similar support for variation orders.     Interface with all disciplines to develop clash-free designs.     Interface with other departments to obtain input for discipline designs and drawings.     Maintain close co-ordination with other engineering disciplines, Planning, fabrication, Marine, and Project Management Team, as required.     Document substantive communications (communications that result in significant decisions or assignment of actions) and forward copies to Discipline Lead Engineer and Discipline Manager.     Prepare estimates for bid proposals, including technical query reviews, execution statements and manhour estimates, identifying software requirements and any other project-specific requirements.     Raise technical queries to obtain missing information, clarify work scope, and to maintain preferred Mcdermott procedures, specifications, standards, practices, and operational requirements.     Prepare, review, and (as Lead Engineer) approve engineering design basis, philosophies, and technical specifications.     Participate in finalizing deliverable lists and deliverables, ensuring compliance with specifications and functional integrity     Review project schedule and fabrication schedule in relation to construction sequence, milestones, and engineering scope.     Attend project kickoff and review meetings, vendor meetings, engineering meetings and offshore site surveys, as required     Provide technical direction and review of Designers producing products related to Construction Support Engineering.     Prepare, review, and (as Lead Engineer) approve design reports and procedures     Assist in providing necessary design inputs to other disciplines to enable them in proceeding with their deliverables.     Assist procurement personnel in procuring discipline equipment, materials and services; ensuring that work produced complies with Customer objectives and procedures. Procurement assistance includes preparing, reviewing, and (as Lead Engineer) approving requisitions, evaluating technical quotations and preparing queries, compiling bid tabulations and recommendations, preparing purchase requisitions, and coordinating with Procurement to expedite vendor documents, as directed by Discipline Lead Engineer.     Review and (as Lead Engineer) approve vendor and subcontractor submittals, checking for compliance with project specifications and providing comments as necessary.     Review and (as Lead Engineer) approve design verification through single-discipline check /inter-discipline check (IDC)     Provide technical support to all fabrications queries, including identifying defect/rectification requirements.     Keep the Discipline Manager and Project Management Team apprised of all activities and concerns, technical, budgetary and manpower related.     Assist in providing inputs for actual, planning and forecasting progress reports including associated productivity.     Check final subcontractor and vendor data manuals to ensure that all requested data has been received and approved.     Present issues and problems to Customers in a timely manner and assist Lead Engineer in negotiating resolution in accordance with project and company requirements.     Perform (as required) Technical Quality Audit reviews in accordance with MDR Global procedures     Assist Project engineer with responses to Customer and other agencies (such as certifying authorities, auditors, third parties, etc.) on their review and approval.     Capture lessons learned and enter into MDR s Lessons Learned system.     Provide leadership, mentoring and guidance to other Engineers     Supervise and guide assigned engineers and coordinate with Lead Designers for Discipline engineering and design deliverables.     Assign personnel to analysis and design tasks based on knowledge of individual strengths and capabilities.     Monitor costs of own work processes.     Evaluate costs associated with products and solutions     Assist in the maintenance of departmental technical guidelines and standard calculation notes.     Participate in development and maintenance of Global Procedures, Software, and Standards.     May participate in standards development committees or task groups such as API     Recognized as having good communication and presentation skills(eg published technical papers are clearly written, actively participates in conferences or seminars, and/or is a capable presenter of design solutions or topics at MDR learning sessions.     Assist Department Manager in identifying departmental needs including development of personnel and technical capabilities     Participate in McDermott forums and represent McDermott as a subject matter expert(SME).     Provide information on employee performance to the Discipline Manager.     Assist Discipline manager in interviewing job applicants.     Perform, review, and (as Lead Engineer) approve designs, analyses, evaluations, calculations and procedures such as :     Erection sequences for jackets, topsides and other structures     Loadout procedure and guidance during the operations     Construction lift analyses and procedures for activities such as floatovers, stackings, rollups etc     Weighing Procedures     Design and detailing of miscellaneous fabrication yard items     Crane arrangements and rigging arrangements     Trailer arrangements/operations     Assist in coordinating critical operations pre-activity meetings         When acting as Lead engineer, in addition:     Act as discipline point of contact in communications and meetings with customer counterparts.     Ensure substantive communications are documented.     Prepare bids and projects discipline engineering budget and execution plans.     Identify project staff needs based on knowledge of individual engineer s skill sets and provide requests to the discipline manager.     Plan, organize and assign tasks, responsibilities, and manhour budgets to the discipline team, and verify tasks are completed within budgets.     Plan discipline deliverable schedule/register compliant with the overall execution plan.     Prepare work forecasts identifying change management plans, corrective action and real-time schedule.     Provide discipline inputs for actual, planning and forecasting progress reports including associated productivity.     Alert project team of any deviation from the scope or a need for change order.     Monitor KPI measurement results and take corrective action as necessary to improve Discipline performance, including performance at interfaces with others.     Coordinate with other Discipline Lead engineers and Designers to ensure timely receipt of necessary design inputs.     Review and approve requisitions, technical quotation evaluations and queries, compiled bid tabulations, and coordinate with Procurement to expedite vendor documents as required.     Lead the Discipline team during project audits (internal, Customer and third-party technical audits) and Design reviews.     Review comments from Customers & other agencies on documents and drawings produced by the team, and resolve/give guidance on their update and incorporation.     Assist Discipline manager in the preparation of quarterly forecasts and manpower planning.     Anticipate project engineering needs and plan accordingly.     Coordinate with vendor for discipline managed/produced items.     Assist Discipline manager and Project Engineering Manager or Project Manager in Performance Evaluation of project team members.
column11: Fabrication, Change management, Project management, Quality audit, Project engineering, Engineering Design, Vendor, Subject Matter Expert, Operations, Technical support

column2: Our client is a leading Business Consulting firm looking to hire an Manager Corporate Taxation consulting based in Delhi. You    will be a part of Corporate Tax team              As the Manager in Taxation Consulting, you will play a crucial role in the Corporate taxation consulting team within the organization for clients across India and other international markets     Youll be    assisting clients on varied corporate tax issues, tax advisories involving domestic tax, DTAA implications, digital tax, cross border transactions, evaluating jurisprudence, analyzing transactions end-to end from Income-tax, FEMA perspective, deal with tax controversy / litigation matters of clientele, etc           Key Responsibilities:      Must be an active contributor in developing new clients promoting growth in the practice.       Develop and implement tax planning strategies to minimize tax liabilities and optimize financial outcomes     Provide expert advice on international and domestic tax matters, transfer pricing, and tax implications of business transactions.     Collaborate with clients to understand their unique tax challenges and formulate tailored solutions.     Stay updated on tax laws and regulations to ensure compliance and mitigate risks.     Manage client relationships, addressing concerns, and identifying opportunities for additional services.     Conduct tax research and analysis to support clients and internal stakeholders.     Prepare and review tax returns, provision calculations, and other tax-related documents.     Lead tax controversy resolution efforts, including representing clients in dealings with tax authorities.     Participate in business development activities, including proposal development and client presentations.     Contribute to the strategic direction and growth of the taxation consulting practice.     Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver integrated client solutions.     Monitor and report on key performance metrics and financial targets for the department.     Ensure adherence to professional standards, ethics, and quality in all client engagements.     Conduct performance evaluations and provide ongoing feedback and coaching to team members.           Required Qualifications:         Qualified chartered accountants with experience in Domestic International tax/ Digital tax/ Tax litigation/ DTAAs/ Tax office representation .         Work experience of minimum 5 - 7 years post qualification.       In-depth knowledge of tax laws, regulations, and compliance requirements     Strong client management skills with a proven track record of building and maintaining relationships.     Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities to address complex tax issues.     Project management expertise, including the ability to prioritize and manage multiple engagements.     Effective communication and presentation skills to articulate complex tax strategies to diverse audiences.     Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and adapt to changing priorities.     Proven track record in driving business growth and contributing to the success of the taxation consulting practice.     Thorough understanding of financial and accounting principles related to tax planning and compliance.     Experience with tax technology tools and software applications for efficient tax management.     Commitment to upholding ethical standards and promoting a culture of integrity and excellence.     Ability to travel as needed for client meetings, trainings, and other business-related activities.

Ensures financial data accuracy and consistent reporting of financial health within the      organization and develops functional business plans, manages, and coordinates resources, and leads      the strategic direction of the Shared Services Finance.          The role is responsible for leading and managing      within a Shared Services Finance, including the supervision of staff and the achievement of financial      outcomes      that      meet client      needs.                              Qualifications          Experience:                                          Relevant      experience      in      Business      Administration,      Finance,      and      Accounting      or      a      relevant      discipline with 5+      years      of      work      experience      in a similar role                      Demonstrated      successful      experience      in      stakeholder/customer      engagement      in      a      Shared      Services/Contact      Centre      environment.                  Good      understanding      of      accounting      principles and IFRS      standards                      Familiarity      with      international      development      systems,      policies,      finances,      and      management      in      low-      and      middle-income      countri                      Familiarity      and      experience      working      in different      cultural      contexts                      Proven      ability      to      work      under      pressure, and      with      multiple      concurrent      demands.                    Accountabilities:                                                Supervise      accountancy      procedures,      maintain      general      ledger,      journal      entries,      accounts      analysis,      reconciliation,      filing      of documents,      etc                      Performs      Accounts      Payable,      ie,      verifying      all      invoices      for      payment      and      ensuring      expenditures      are      allocated      and      charged to      appropriate      codes.                      Preparation      of      Monthly      Financial      Statements,      ie,      Monthly      Balance      Sheet,      Income      Statement.                      Calculate/review      payroll      with      statutory      deductions      monthly      to      ensure      local      labor      laws      and      tax      regulations      are      current for      statutory      deductions. Oversee      the      management      of      bank      accounts:      follow      transfers,      check      balances,      check      authorized      expenses,      and      online      transactions.                      Supervise      the      management      of cash: available      amount,      balance      checks.                      Assess monthly cash-flow needs      and communicate cash requests to the      home      Office team      twice      a      month.                      Manage money transfers, cash supply, and amounts in circulation, whilst defining payment      procedures      (bank      transfer,      cheque,      cash,      etc). column2: Sr Engineer (Senior Engineer):A Senior Engineer is a role with higher responsibilities and typically involves more experience than a standard Engineer      Responsibilities may include designing, developing, or maintaining complex systems, projects, or products      Senior Engineers often mentor and provide guidance to junior engineers      They may also be involved in project management or technical leadership within their area of expertise      Engineer:An Engineer is typically an entry to mid-level position      Responsibilities include working on technical tasks, projects, or assignments      Engineers often implement designs, conduct analysis, and provide technical solutions      They may work under the guidance of senior engineers or engineering managers      Asst      Manager (Assistant Manager):An Assistant Manager is generally a mid-level management position      Responsibilities may involve overseeing teams or departments within an organization      Assistant Managers assist their superiors in managing daily operations and making decisions      They often play a role in staff supervision and may have a combination of technical and managerial responsibilities      Deputy Manager:A Deputy Manager is typically a step above Assistant Manager and may have more extensive managerial and leadership responsibilities      They often assist in the management and coordination of larger teams or departments      Deputy Managers may have authority in decision-making and may fill in for higher-level managers in their absence

column2: \     BrowserStack is seeking a seasoned    Lead - Controllership, Payables    proficient in overseeing financial operations on a global scale, particularly focusing on accounts payable, credit card program management, travel claims, and month-end closing procedures across all legal entities. The role emphasizes standardizing financial processes, implementing system automation, and generating process dashboards for management review. Reporting directly to the Senior Director of Finance, this position offers an opportunity to play a pivotal role in shaping the companys financial efficiency and transparency.                 What will you do?               SLA Management:         Oversee requisition-to-pay processes, credit card management, expense reporting, and fixed asset management, ensuring adherence to service level agreements.             Book Closing:         Ensure timely closure of monthly and quarterly financial reporting in alignment with the companys reporting calendar.             SOP & Process Documentation:         Develop and maintain standard operating procedures (SOPs) and process documentation, collaborating with functional leaders to refine and finalize processes independently.             Process Improvement:         Drive process transformation and improvement initiatives aimed at automation and enhancing operational efficiency.             Project Management:         Demonstrate excellent project management skills to lead cross-functional teams in implementing process enhancements and automation.             Process Dashboards:     Create monthly finance dashboards with insightful commentary, covering accounts payable, credit card, and travel expense processes.             Analytical Skills:     Utilise strong analytical abilities to interpret financial ratios, and conduct percentage growth analysis, and variance analysis.             Monthly Schedules:         Oversee key monthly schedules including open purchase orders, purchase requisitions, goods receipt and invoice receipt (GRIR), and fixed asset register maintenance. column2: As a Senior Manager, youll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:           Encourage everyone to have a voice and invite opinion from all, including quieter members of the team.     Deal effectively with ambiguous and unstructured problems and situations.     Initiate open and candid coaching conversations at all levels.     Move easily between big picture thinking and managing relevant detail.     Anticipate stakeholder needs, and develop and discuss potential solutions, even before the stakeholder realises they are required.     Contribute technical knowledge in area of specialism.     Contribute to an environment where people and technology thrive together to accomplish more than they could apart.     Navigate the complexities of cross-border and/or diverse teams and engagements.     Initiate and lead open conversations with teams, clients and stakeholders to build trust.     Uphold the firms code of ethics and business conduct.                             Job Description:     We are seeking a results-driven Workforce Management professional with a proven track record to lead our territory/Business Unit Resource Deployment team.   We are looking for go-getters who can partner with the business leadership to understand the organization s growth and talent strategies and create effective staffing solutions to optimize productivity and minimize cost. The incumbent will create measurable KPIs to monitor and analyze business performance and effectiveness of the Resource Deployment team. (S)he will be responsible and accountable to meet all defined KPIs for the assigned Business Unit, Sub-Business Unit, Industry/Sector or territory. (S)he will also develop a team of high performing professionals that are adept at providing solutions to complex staffing needs.   The incumbent will be responsible to design and implement staffing strategies aligned to future demand projections, staffing needs and budget plans. (S)he will be responsible to analyze current and historical trends, predict future demand and capacity, determine personnel requirements, analyze staffing gaps and identify staffing solutions through conversations and collaboration with multiple teams within our organization.   To ensure success as a Senior Manager, you should possess transformational leadership qualities with a strong focus on continuous improvement. You should be data driven and adept at analyzing large data sets. You must possess strong domain knowledge in Resource Deployment, demand - supply planning, project-based staffing, capacity and headcount planning, demand and supply forecasting, capacity and bench management, scheduling and business analytics.   Prior Resource Deployment experience in Big 4s, Audit/Tax/accounting practice and/or financial services industry will be preferred.           Key Responsibilities:     Implement a strong and dynamic Capacity Planning process focused on short term, long term and strategic workforce planning.   Implement a KPI based operating model for the Resource Deployment team with focus on stakeholder collaboration, value generation, accountability and process transformation.   Perform regular business reviews with stakeholders - Identify staffing gaps/deviations from plan and propose mitigation options.   Analyze annual budget plans and create capacity to enable effective staffing on projects based on scope of work, skills, prior experience, availability, regulatory requirements and budget allocations.   Act as a control owner to ensure 100% compliance on all regulatory requirements and business rules associated with resource allocations and staffing on projects.   Demonstrate success against all business, operational and people management KPIs.   Drive continuous improvement, process transformation, technology enablement and automation to create measurable efficiencies within the team.   Monitor schedule adherence, address schedule changes and resolve staffing conflicts.   Collaborate with Talent acquisition on new hire allocations in accordance with project budgets and Capacity plans.   Create dashboards to monitor, analyze and report against key KPIs.   Regular review and update of process documents.   Stakeholder management - Create strong connects with stakeholders in the business, onshore, cross ACs, Talent, Finance and cross LOS.   Team management - Training/upskilling, backup and succession planning, quality monitoring, performance evaluation, career guidance and overall supervision.           Key Skills and Experiences:     Any Graduate/Post-Graduate. Specialization in Human Resources/Statistics will be preferred.   13 - 15 years of relevant, post qualification work experience in reputed organizations with proven track record of career growth and stability.   Proficiency in Resource Deployment/workforce management domain.   Must have 6-8 years of experience in building and supervising large teams.   Must have 8-10 years of experience in directly managing stakeholders.   Must have 3-5 years of experience in project management/change management/process transformation.   Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.   Excellent negotiation skills.   Excellent process documentation and presentation skills - knowledge in using MS Visio, PowerPoint and Google Slides to create impactful process flows and presentations.   Exceptional organizational and time-management skills with a proven record of working under tight deadlines.   Very strong team management skills.   Strong knowledge of Power BI, Spotfire, Tableau and Google Charts will be preferred.

column2: The Strategy & Consulting Global Network Song Practice Join our team of Strategy & Consulting Global Network Song consultants who solve customer facing challenges at clients spanning sales, service and marketing to accelerate business change. Practice:Strategy & Consulting Global Network Song I Areas of Work:Marketing, Sales & Service | Level:Manager | Location:Delhi, Gurgaon, Mumbai, Bangalore | Years of Exp:8 years Explore an Exciting Career at Accenture Are you passionate about scaling businesses using in-depth frameworks and techniques to solve customer facing challenges? Do you want to design, build and implement strategies to enhance business performance? Does working in an inclusive and collaborative environment spark your interest? Then, this is the right place for you! Welcome to a host of exciting global opportunities within Accenture Strategy & Consulting's Customer, Sales & Service practice. The Practice A Brief Sketch The Strategy & Consulting Global Network Song practice is aligned to the Global Network Song Practice of Accenture and works with clients across their marketing, sales and services functions. As part of the team, you will provide transformation services driven by key offerings like Living Marketing, Connected Commerce and Next-Generation Customer Care. These services help our clients become living businesses by optimizing their marketing, sales and customer service strategy, thereby driving cost reduction, revenue enhancement, customer satisfaction and impacting front end business metrics in a positive manner. You will work closely with our clients as consulting professionals who design, build and implement initiatives that can help enhance business performance. As part of the team, you will drive the following Manage customer journeys across the lifecycle:Leverage the comprehensive suite of analytics, consulting and technology solutions that Accenture offers to create relevant customer experiences across the customer lifecycle, drive business performance, identify cost optimization opportunities through people, process or technology interventions. Manage solution design & execution:Lead process and technology assessment, KPI and definition, solution and vendor assessment for different technologies Monitor trends and analyze data to optimize solutions:Identify continuous process improvement opportunities Develop business case for designed strategies Project Management:Mobilize and organize teams across multiple stakeholders (client and internal) and projectsBring your best skills forward to excel at the role: Ability to conduct research to unearth facts and generate actionable insights/ ability to translate findings into actionable insights Bring your strong analytical skills to analyze large volumes of data and combine them with macroeconomic factors and competitive benchmarking to cull out insights relevant to stakeholder teams Gather business requirements, design process & solution implementation:Collaborate with various client and Accenture business and technology stakeholders in implementing solutions and assisting in change management and adoption of the new tool/process Communication and Presentation Skills to share the perfect pitch with key stakeholders Client handling skills to develop, manage and deepen relationships with key stakeholdersRead about us. Blogs Qualification Your experience counts! column2: As part of the day-to day activities, the role will liaise with the different business stakeholders on system strategies leading to process improvement and technology solution implementations. Will lead the selection of technology tools, identification, and specification of systems enhancements, oversee testing strategies, govern master data, assist with implementation on compliance and controls around these systems and troubleshoot end user issues.     This role will also manage the project life cycle of a number of business initiatives including but not limited to new business integration, and financial systems and process upgrades that will lead to supporting modernization efforts.     The role will also have a focus on the following main types of large-scale initiatives:     Business Transformation projects, including process optimization/automation and new technology implementation.     Integration of acquired companies, including operational integration of any businesses outside of standard.         TWDC systems and processes, migration to SAP and retirement of legacy systems     Regulatory and compliance initiatives, including SOX, changes in Tax laws, implementation of electronic. invoicing and reporting mandates, etc.         The candidate must have a strong accounting/finance as well as program and project management background.     He/ She should have strong experience in international accounting, including US and International GAAP and     electronic financial statements filing. A solid background on Tax requirements including tax calculation and electronic tax reporting.     The person will need to have demonstrable experience leading and supporting.initiatives in the full Source to Pay cycle, including international rules on AP processing and payments settlement,including international banking. Also, vast experience in the Credit to Cash area, including International revenue recognition, B2B and B2C billing including different types of electronic invoicing mandates. Experience in cash application and bank reconciliation automation will also be important. Deep knowledge of cross-country intercompany process. International T&E rules, such as common tax deductibility requirements will be desirable.     This candidate should be familiar with current best practices and new technological trends to enhance the effectiveness of the transaction processing, reconciliation, reporting and month / quarter end closing.     The candidate should have proven history of building and maintaining excellent client service relationships, interact and partner with executives at all levels to help drive collaborative business decisions. A leader or leaders the candidate must have strong motivational skills as well as vast leadership and team management experience to direct and mentor teams to meet objectives, excellent communication skills, work in a fast-paced environment, and adaptable to business priority changes with ease.
column11: Procurement, Automation, Team management, SAP, Business transformation, Project management, Process improvement, Reconciliation, Billing, Business operations

column2: Manage all aspects of a large scale and complex project, from start to finish, so that it is completed on time and within budget.         MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES         Design, communicate, and implement an operational plan for completing a project; monitor progress and performance against the project plan; resolve operational problems, minimize delays.     Identify, develop, and gather necessary resources to complete the project.     Prepare designs and work specifications; develop schedules, budgets and forecasts; select materials, equipment, project staff, and contractors.     Estimate costs, resources, and time required to complete.     Monitor activities, allocate resources, and assign tasks to ensure targets are met.     Liaise with other areas in the organization to secure specialized resources and contributions for the project.     Conduct project meetings and prepare reports to communicate the status of the project within and beyond the project team.     Coach and mentor project staff and assist them to solve problems. column2: A career in IBM Consulting is rooted by long-term relationships and close collaboration with clients across the globe. With deep expertise in many industries, we offer strategy, experience, technology and operations services to many of the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Our people are focused on accelerating our clients businesses through the power of collaboration. We believe in the power of technology responsibly used to help people, partners and the planet. Curiosity and a constant quest for knowledge serve as the foundation to success in IBM Consulting. In your role, youll be encouraged to challenge the norm, investigate ideas outside of your role and come up with creative solutions resulting in ground breaking impact for a wide network of clients. Our culture of evolution and empathy centres on long-term career growth and development opportunities in an environment that embraces your unique skills and experience. Ability to manage change and be open to it good time management and an ability to work under stress Proven interpersonal skills while contributing to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed Maintain technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing publications

Develop a point of view on key global trends, and how they impact clients.         Manage a variety of viewpoints to build consensus and create positive outcomes for all parties.         Simplify complex messages, highlighting and summarising key points.         Uphold the firms code of ethics and business conduct.                   Specific responsibilities include but are not limited to:           Provide guidance to clients regarding compliance with global tax information reporting rules         Research complex tax issues and reach appropriate conclusions for our clients.         Apply tax technical skills in reviewing US Internal Revenue Service (IRS) tax forms including: Forms W-9,         W-8BEN, W-8BEN-E, W-8ECI, W-8EXP and W-8IMY, related tax documentary evidence as well as         Common Reporting Standard (CRS) self-certifications         Lead staff in preparing and filing information returns (e.g., Forms 1099 and 1042-S), FBAR, and Automatic         Exchange of Information (FATCA CRS) returns         Develop innovative technology solutions to increase efficiency such as digital tools that capture and process         information         Assist in the development of educational materials for information reporting and withholding requirements for both internal and client workshops         Train and manage local staff and contribute to the development of your team s technical acumen               Minimum years experience required           5+ years of relevant experience               Additional requirements               Have a fundamental understanding of the applicable US tax rules and requirements including IRS publications and tax form instructions         Familiarity with the the requirements under the Common Reporting Standard (CRS) as set out by the OECD and the Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act (FATCA)         Excellent written, organizational, and verbal communication skills.         Strong analytical, problem solving, and project management skills.         The desire to drive success as both an individual contributor and team member.         Ability to identify and address our client needs by actively participating in client discussions and meetings.         Attention to detail with a strong work ethic; and         Willingness to travel in a post-covid world

column2: You are part of Customs Trade Export Control India team, reporting directly to CTEC APAC director.                                     You are proactively driving customs and trade compliance to deliver competitiveness E2E and enable customer success.                                     You are responsible for Capturing Trade opportunities to enable customer success, adapting to difficult or challenging regulation changes, collaborating in a dynamic environment with internal and external partners, leveraging a digitalized and transparent data value chain.                                     This role is also responsible to customs brokerage management, HS classification, and trade compliance authority (eg, Customs) relations.                                             Your Contribution                                                       ?                     Be Accountable. Be Proactive. Stay Hungry and Humble. Collaborate. Challenge. Passion and Trust. These are the behaviors you'll need for success.                                                      ?                       In this role you will:                                         Act as the companys primary contact for customs and trade relevant authorities                                     As a natural leader, leading through people, functions to be compliance at Volvo group. grow stake holder s compliance ambassadors.                                        Develop, document, maintain and drive enforcement of local Indian policies and procedures regarding trade.                                       Responsible for HS classification, customs valuation, Country of Origin, Permit/License application, Customs Privileges eg Free Zone, CKD, Bonded Facilities                                     Secure and manage significant customs areas eg, Rules of Origin, Free Trade Agreements                                 (FTA), customs regimes, regulatory requirements and other local restrictions.                                                                     Manage, handle, and mitigate existing and/or pending cases eg, Customs duty drawback, Bank Guarantee, EPCG, Ted refund and other relevant schemes/ regimes including controversy and dispute cases.                                            Create and maintain strong relationships with Legal Departments, Sales and Tax.                                                  Work very closely with Group Tax team/Sales, to proactively and in a timely manner manage any potential Tax, Customs and related Transfer Pricing risks to Volvo Group.                                                 Establish customs broker Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Score Cards (SCs); perform trade compliance review/audits to brokers and drive implementation of corrective actions arising from findings.                                                 Proactively identify value-added opportunities to improve trade duty competitiveness, minimize compliance risks and reduce costs.                                                 Proactively identify trade-related regulatory changes and ensure that policy/process updates are made, communicated, and implemented.                                                 Provide advice regarding Trade Barriers, BIS, Import Quota, Import Prohibition and Restriction, Government Policies including silent/ambiguous rules to stakeholders.                                                 Provide and/or facilitate internal and external training to teams/vendors that directly or indirectly manage activities that impact export and import compliance.                                               Drive and participate in Customs Systems/ Automated solutions.                                             Participate in identification of current and potential risks regarding Export Control                                           Maintain accurate record keeping and retention process.                                         Assist in external audits manage relevant certifications and licenses (AEO/CTPAT)                                         Support and conduct risk assessments to identify compliance concerns and coordinate with appropriate partners to achieve the resolution.                                         Pursue cost savings strategies as a priority within Customs and Import/Export Control team in alignment with Volvo Group Strategies.                                         Represent Volvo Group in Professional Trade bodies and ensure business is updated on latest regulations.                                           Essential Education and/or Training Qualifications:                                         Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of import and trade regulatory compliance in India, including use of bonded facilities, ECCN, customs valuation.                                             Demonstrated experience in developing and deploying process improvements and best practices across organizational functions with a strong focus on results.                                             Must have at least 8 years of experience in a fast-paced environment                                             Ability to analyse information/data thoroughly and accurately (including those requiring the use of Excel, Power BI, other automation tools etc.)                                       Experiences in Consulting and automotive industry is preferable.                                     Prior working experience with regional customs authorities in APAC region is an added                      advantage.                                           Preferred Experience and Knowledge:                                         Good understanding of the Volvo Businesses, especially the logistics set-ups in Volvo.                                             Strong leadership, inspiring, and result oriented.                                             Strong communication and presentation skills                                             Structured work approach with Project management skills                                             Significant change management abilities                                              Demonstrated ability to work independently without direct supervision.                                              Solid analytical, digital, and problem-solving skills.                                             Creativity/Innovation: Reframing traditional patterns of thinking and applying new and evolving ideas, methods, designs and technologies.                                              High skills in building strong networks/relationships with other departments.

column2: As part of the Global Financial Initiatives and Integrity organization within Corporate Controllership, this role is responsible for providing financial integrity of accounting, reporting, and control changes in technology development for Line of Business or Finance initiatives.    This position will provide analysis and inputs for project initiatives, defining financial needs and developing user stories.     The role will also be responsible for developing, reviewing test cases, and providing post warranty coverage for technology deployed financial requirements driven by the Line of Business or Finance organization. The responsibilities will include consultancy on finance initiatives including support on technology, end-to-end processes, and other initiatives. When applicable Project Manager is expected to provide thought leadership and support to project analysts.                        Job Responsibilities   :                  Responsible to ensure compliance to AEMP 16 and all other relevant AXP and Finance policies.                Responsible for engaging in business initiatives requiring technology development with financial, reporting, or accounting impacts.              Responsible to lead platform modernization efforts for finance.              Responsible for defining end-to-end balancing and controls within financial processes.              Responsible for creating accounting requirements in consultation with Segment and Market Controllership              Responsible to design changes/updates to reporting in consultation with finance process owners                  Responsible for conducting user acceptance testing of finance requirements.              Ensure new finance process is operationalized and maintained post implementation.                Proactively identify project and operational risks and escalate to leadership and key stakeholders to remediate.               Provide consultancy and business advisory to the business where GFII skills are needed.              Provide support through the project life cycle when project engagement identified.                Responsible to deliver regular project status updates.                  Document outcomes of project and solicit feedback from customers, business partners, and other key stakeholders engaged in project life cycle.                  Provide support to new and existing finance initiatives.                  Responsible for providing thought leadership and guidance to Project Analyst.                  Support Director on transformation initiatives and managing Line of Business relationships.                     Required Skills/Qualifications       :                    At minimum, three to five years experience with accounting, reporting processes or relevant business and technology experience.                  Three to five years experience in defining system development requirements across business and technologies.                Three to five years experience in defining and validating system development and financial test cases.              Strong knowledge of American Express processes and systems required.                  Understanding of US GAAP requirements and financial control principles and practices.                  Proven project management experience and system implementation background is preferred.              Transformational approach to process efficiency and effectiveness.              Demonstrated strategic thinking and results driven approach with an ability to convert    strategic vision into clear project outcomes including skills to analyze highly complex processes, data volume and translate into actionable items.                  Ability to identify potential risks and opportunities when assessing new product development and/ or system upgrades including         sound judgment and decision-making relative cost, risk and benefits.                Strong relationship management and conflict resolution skills with a proven track of positively collaborating, influencing, and extensively coordinating with internal and external partners including senior leaders.              Recognizes the importance of teamwork to achieve objectives; brings in ideas, information, suggestions, and expertise from others outside the immediate team.              A desire to work in an environment of significant change with the ability to collaborate and influence without authority              Proven ability to build strong and lasting relationships within team and across multiple organizations.              Exemplifies    a growth mindset where continual knowledge and learning are expected, challenges are embraced and setbacks are opportunities to learn forward looking and thinking.                Excellent written and verbal communications with ability to    communicate highly complex concepts and processes in simple terms and pragmatically.                Must be able to communicate results to all stakeholders, which can include finance, technical, non-finance, and non-technical individuals.              Must be a self-starter with an ability to drive large scale change, motivated with the ability to work in dynamic environment, able to adapt to unforeseen obstacles and create compelling action plan.              High Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Power Point, Visio) is a requirement to aid on written and visual communication as well as analytics.                Typically holds a bachelor s or master s degree in accounting, Computer Science, Information Systems, or other related field or has equivalent work experience.

column1: Infra DCO - Service Utility - RCA & Control Governance
column2: Role Description The Group Chief Operating Office (GCOO) division acts as the bridge between businesses and infrastructure functions to oversee and enable the remediation of the banks most critical findings and deliver the next phase of transformation and manage the banks costs, The Divisional Control Office (DCO) as a key pillar of GCOO is responsible for internal control and governance across the Infrastructure functions eg. Chief Administrative Office, Chief Financial Office, Chief Risk Office, HR, Procurement, with a key focus on the management of the findings portfolio and the non-financial risk profile. The Findings & Risk Analyst will support GCOO DCOs efforts to actively manage the findings portfolio of the Infrastructure functions, by supporting and challenging the finding owners throughout the lifecycle and provide appropriate reporting. Risk management skills and a control mindset forms the basis to identify, analyse and report the non-financial risks of the Infrastructure division, thereby ensuring that Group and Functional standards are consistently applied. The candidate is required to demonstrate strong stakeholder management and Microsoft office skills with an understanding of non-financial risk management activities. The role will have full exposure to all infrastructure areas and requires working closely with a variety of stakeholders. The role has considerable scope for professional development, both as the Divisional Control Team continues to grow and evolve and due to the broad understanding of Risk that will be developed through the work undertaken. Your key responsibilities  Analysing findings and risk data, including production of relevant MI or escalation/challenging the issues. Preparation of monthly, quarterly packs and various periodic reporting for Findings Management process. Provide ad hoc DCO data analysis requests. Providing meeting materials for Infrastructure and functional forums on non-financial risk management. Analysis of existing data exceptions related to findings and controls and supporting their remediation. Testing new tools/updates to existing tools and support their implementation. Supporting the team/stakeholders with reporting on various stages of findings lifecycle management, where applicable. Supporting the implementation of the Infrastructure control framework, through control oversight and support delivery of other functional risk review processes Supporting the development of the Functional control framework, including enhancements to the controls inventory and related processes. Supporting the development of standards of the risk assessment. Your skills and experience Strong analytical skills to interpret and analyse data. Strong stakeholder management skills. Good understanding of risk management activities and internal control frameworks. Basic understanding of non-financial risk. Good multitasker with problem solving attitude. The ability to successfully navigate a complex organisation, build strong relationships and work collaboratively with diverse stakeholders across the bank Very good Microsoft Office skills, particularly Excel and PowerPoint
column11: stakeholder management, vendor management, risk management, project management, operations management, people management skills, team management, program management, business analysis, agile, change management

column2: Role Description Accounting Control ensures all transactions are correctly accounted for and provides a golden source financial information data set upon which all internal and external reporting is based. Work includes Ensuring the integrity of reportable financial information up to, and including, release of disclosure relevant financial information and operation of Revenue, Cost, Local and Group close processes including managing intercompany B/S and P&L breaks in the Groups consolidated financial statements Ensuring that all DB-internal and external transactions (including Compensation related transactions) are compliant with key policies, tax and regulatory standards and are governed, processed and controlled in order to deliver timely and accurate reporting. Your key responsibilities Ensure complete understanding of and contribute to further development and ongoing maintenance of Finance Control Oversights (FCO) various risk and control frameworks for Finance with corresponding guidelines, controls, and training All Control activities and respective procedures, serving as the gate keeper of relevant information and output to enable Finance risk management oversight. Support preparation and delivery of risk and control MI, and drive changes on an ongoing basis. Obtain input from and facilitate discussions between relevant stakeholders, support development of agreeable solutions Support governance activities Finance Governance forums, prepare presentations and other material Perform high quality reporting on the Regulatory Reporting Adherence process, also covering Findings Management, Risk and Control Assessment MI Testing the controls, reviewing exceptions, coordinating remediation activities. Oversight and monitoring of Controls Inventory and Regulatory Reports Inventory and Quality Assurance Incident research, remediation monitoring, and other ad hoc control initiatives and projects. Your skills and experience Skills Youll Need  Understanding of risks and controls and practical application of control principles as well as an understanding of front-to-back control environments; ability to assess design and operating effectiveness Experience in Data Analytics, Audit, Financial Services, Regulatory Reporting/ Comprehensive Capital Analysis and Review (CCAR) a plus Degree in Accounting or related field Skills That Will Help You Excel Project management skills and the ability to prioritize and coordinate various deliverables across multiple owners Able to operate effectively within a global organization working with teams across multiple entities; ability to challenge existing processes and recommend process and control improvements where relevant Proficiency with MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) Critical thinking and analysis.

Professional & Technical Skills: Must To Have Skills:Expertise in SAP FI S/4HANA Accounting. Good To Have Skills:Experience in Business & Technology Delivery. Strong understanding of business architecture principles and practices. Experience in developing business cases and delivering impactful solutions. Excellent communication and collaboration skills. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 5 years of experience in SAP FI S/4HANA Accounting. The JOB FAMILY and PROJECT ROLE information are not for candidate's experience. This position is based at our Mumbai office. Qualification NA

column2: As a Manager Transfer Pricing based out of Hyderabad, you will be responsible to Prepare and maintain multi-country transfer pricing documentation, conducting financial analysis and assisting in tax planning.     The role will report to the Director, Global Transfer Pricing.         How you will contribute            The responsibilities of the position include but are not limited to the following:      Prepare and maintain necessary multi-country transfer pricing documentation, ensuring compliance with respective local laws and transfer pricing policies, including Master File, Local Files and Country by Country Reporting.     Conduct detailed financial analysis and segmentation of PL statements to develop data required for transfer pricing studies.     Assist with tax planning and other special projects on global level, as needed, supporting technical analyses and/or documentation on transfer pricing impacts.     Manage testing and monitoring of profitability targets in line with applicable functional profile of legal entities and assess need for TP adjustments, coordinating and collaborating with internal stakeholders.               Job Requirements             What you will need to be successful           Degree in Economics, Business, Finance, Accounting or a related field       8+ years of experience, majority of which in Transfer Pricing or related field in economic and/or financial results.     Preferably some experience in big 4 public accounting firms and/or multi-national corporate finance/tax department.     Knowledge and expertise in OECD Transfer Pricing Guidelines      Fluency in English required.     Proficiency in Microsoft Office products (advance knowledge of excel is required)      Strong finance/accounting knowledge, working knowledge of financial accounting systems.     Strong interpersonal, writing, analytical, project management, organizational and problem-solving skills.

column2: To provide financial costing, pricing and deal shaping support to our Sales team for our large and complex Global opportunities. Prepare schedules for open issues and propose an action plan to address shortfalls in readiness for Accenture deal approval Work with deal teams to use the costing information above in conjunction with knowledge of the deal shape/commercial parameters to calculate the price and margin using internal pricing tools. Assist deal teams with analysis of above to understand risks, provide mitigation and identify opportunities for a client, Accenture, and other stakeholders. Analyze financial impact accordingly. Understand and work within the ambit of US GAAP policies and ensure a clear understanding of risks and opportunities of deal shape when overlaid by each stakeholders regulatory environment. Co-ordinate with the tax and legal team to assure Client and Accenture tax efficiency and legality in instances of resource transfer, asset transfer, asset purchase, leasing, resale, subcontractors etc. Present the above financial context to the Sales Leads, Finance leads and other stakeholders to influence outcomes of deal shaping & client negotiations and assist with decision making Escalate, if required, deals with poor financial metrics and work with teams for those deals to improve the quality of the financial attributes before moving forward Commitment to thought leadership and continuous learning by regularly contributing to CDTS knowledge capital. column2: The Model Validation team is responsible for Model Risk Management for Bread Financial Models and Bank Models for the entire organization. Members of this team work with teams across the business (Marketing, Pricing, finance, etc.) that build the models to understand and validate the methodology. The Model Validation, Manager is a key member of the Model Risk Management (MRM) team. Key responsibilities include executing against the overall model risk management framework and assisting in independent validation of models used by the business.                 Essential Job Functions                       Process and Project Management: Conducts model validations independently without any supervision.      Acts as a leader, and coaches team members, if needed. Maintains a basic functional knowledge of model risk concepts and works with the business units to communicate key guiding principles.      Performs end-to-end validations/testing of basic or less complex models/tools. Internal and client facing with oversight, guidance and review from management.        Validation/testing involves identifying the key risks associated with a model, planning a risk-based validation approach and scope.          Designs and conducts validation tests, recognizing gaps in model risk management and governance, and drafting a model validation report.              Quality Assurance: Checks the model s accuracy and demonstrates the model is robust and stable. Assesses potential limitations and evaluating the model s behavior over a range of input values.          Assesses the impact of assumptions and identifies situations where the model performs poorly or becomes unreliable.          Evaluates formal results of analysis performed and draft formal model validation documentation and proposed risk rating assessment.                     Business Communications and Relationships: Demonstrates professional and proficient verbal and written communication skills when working with internal and external partners. Builds relationships by establishing trust, confidence and credibility with senior leaders, executives, and internal partners.          Is proactive, demonstrates a strong work ethic, and shows initiative to build the business in a result driven environment.          Utilizes critical thinking skills to help analyze business issues, collaborates with stakeholders to resolve problems, is strategic and flexible when needed, and gains consensus on the best solution.             Leadership: Leads, Coaches, motivates, challenges and provides managerial guidance to the team.     Develops and executes training programs for the team.          Utilizes excellent communication skills to articulate a strategic vision to the team. Solves problems and makes decisions with sound judgement. column2: The Global Process Manager (GPM) - Record to Report (R2R) is responsible for driving global process standardization, transactional efficiency, organizational capability, process performance, and a prioritized roadmap of all global R2R processes. The position assures that quality, operation, and customer satisfactions objectives are achieved. The position analyzes policy with policy-owner (Corporate Finance), streamlines process to support policy and establishes key performance indicators for the global R2R processes. This role has accountability for R2R process excellence and is expected to provide the R2R GPO with recommendations to drive change across assigned disciplines.                                Key Responsibilities                              Define and implement the global R2R process roadmap to deliver targeted business benefits and ease of process use for the end user. Key sub-process components include month end closing, journal entries, account reconciliations, Intercompany, Fixed Assets, lease and Cash and Banking.                         Influence and align with R2R GPO on potential R2R process changes.                         Provide insights into shaping policies related to R2R process and institute process improvements to drive improved adherence to policies.                        Define and implement KPIs and performance measures associated with the R2R process. Lead benchmarking activities and continuous assessment of global process performance measures, driving measurable improvements in the process over time.                       Support R2R GPO in any system implementation / enhancement initiatives to the extent impacting R2R process.                          Identify, drive, and monitor continuous improvement related to the R2R process and create opportunities to bring service innovation to Kohler Co.                          Ensure adequate and timely root cause analysis to understand problem drivers and implementation of necessary corrections and/or changes.                          Identify and drive process automation including robotics for the process area.                         In consultation with business/functions and service delivery teams, support the identification, prioritization and implementation of process improvements, to drive better business outcomes.                         Establish and sustain process change control for R2R processes.                         Provide R2R process expertise for shared service migrations, business integrations including M&A activities.                         Build and maintain partnerships with process technology partners.                               The Person - Qualifications & Experience                               BS degree in Accounting, Finance, or General Management, or relevant work experience.                                 Minimum 5 years of Finance and Accounting experience in a complex, global organization.                                  Minimum 5 years of experience related to close, inclusive of all financial reporting.                                 Demonstrated experience working in a matrixed global environment.                                 Stakeholder management experience with ability to influence and persuade key stakeholder and to constructively deal with conflicts.                                 Full P&L and Balance sheet experience for a complex global organization a plus.                                 Strong understanding of compliance and background in designing and implementing financial controls.                                  In-depth understanding of SAP or other major ERP systems capabilities.                                 In-depth understanding of month-end close processes, KPIs for driving improvements, governance cadence and driving process improvements to remove friction in closing.                                  Strong understanding of specific accounting processes like Intercompany, fixed assets, lease, journal entries, account reconciliations, and cash and banking.                                 Demonstrable experience of executing process transformation initiatives or delivering enterprise systems.                                 Experience with implementation of RPA technologies within R2R desirable.                                 Program and project management experience required.                                 Formal continuous improvement (e.g. Lean / Six Sigma) desirable.                                 Strong written and oral communication skills.

column2: We are seeking a Senior International Tax Manager, reporting to the Sr      Director of Tax, to lead the international tax provision, compliance and reporting function      This position will interface with personnel at various levels of the Company including regional finance teams as well as external partners      Primary responsibilities include managing the Companys international tax processes including US international tax, transfer pricing, foreign direct tax compliance, reporting, and forecasting      This position will also play a key role in supporting worldwide income tax provision, tax planning, audits by governmental authorities, and process improvements      The ideal candidate will have strong technical and analytical skills, strong organizational and communication skills, and be detail-oriented and hands-on              Responsibilities          Manage the US international tax compliance function including global withholding taxes ( WHT ); lead the automation of the withholding tax workflows and compliance processes      Maintain, and track US international tax attributes including basis and E&P      Liaise across tax, finance, treasury, legal, HR, and with external advisors to ensure compliance      Research, evaluate and document tax implications of complex or non-standard US and international transactions; recommend solutions and advise on WHT tax implications on deals      Perform and review US international tax calculations including but not limited to FTC, GILTI, FDII, and BEAT; review of US international compliance forms prepared by third party services firms      Model international tax calculations to incorporate into forecasts for planning purposes      Review of FIN48 analyses for international tax positions; support inquires by governmental authorities related to US international and foreign tax matters.      Evaluate tax planning opportunities available to the company (such as tax structure reorganizations, elections) to minimize the companys taxes. Ensure that all claimed positions have the requisite level of authority and communicate risks associated with uncertain positions.
