column2: The pricing Manger should possess knowledge of quantitative and qualitative data analysis methods and work in an environment with large complex data sets     This position will collaborate across all parts of the organization to develop market understanding and employ data management tools to create understanding     This role will develop pricing excellence capabilities and deliver strategic pricing plans and initiatives to drive operational improvement across Actuation Technologies product lines globally             As a Manager, Strategic pricing, your Responsibilities Will Be:         Work closely with the strategic business units, sales, and project leaders to develop coordinated pricing strategies, identify new business / pricing opportunities, and communicate pricing rationale across the business.     Determine methodology to analyze historical pricing information to determine the best price points for the business.     Define and track price metrics, KPI s, and best practices across the company globally, identify actions.     Mine data, analyze and interpret results using standard statistical tools and techniques.     Employ statistical modeling methods to determine the impact of pricing strategies and identify opportunities.     Benchmark and maintain visibility into current pricing performance by product and geography.     Track the effectiveness of annual/midyear price adjustments and quantify the realized impact.     Track the contribution of specific price improvement initiatives and report regularly.     Identify and implement price improvement opportunities.     Identify price leakage opportunities and develop remedies and prevention measures.     Take lead role in the annual development and dissemination of the Global Price Books     Maintain product, market, and channel knowledge and regularly monitor industry pricing practices, particularly for major competitors and distributors.     Coordinate with all world areas on price increases     Collaborate with the Business Analytics and Intelligent Automation teams to develop tools enabling data driven pricing decisions, creating visuals, and delivering business.     Collaborate with IT and other departments for pricing inputs supporting development of Digital commerce (Configure Price Quote) tools.     Provide input on new product pricing strategies.     Assist sales with pricing intelligence and impacts.     Manage a team of Pricing Analyst located in Chennai.         Who You Are:           You know how businesses work and how organizations make money     You understand the meaning and implications of key financial indicators     You understand internal and external stakeholder requirements, expectations, and needs     You keep a strong bottom-line orientation     You come up with useful ideas that are new, better, or unique, introducing new ways of looking at problems     You ask the right questions to accurately analyze situations     You are an effective leader who drives team engagement             Education, skill, and experience, you require for this role:         Bachelor s degree in engineering     12+ years of overall experience preferably in Pricing, Statistics, Engineering, Marketing, Sales, Finance, or Accounting with an industrial (business-to-business) company selling configured products.     6+ years of Supervisor Experience including setting up annual objectives, performance evaluation, identifying & planning upskilling of team members apart from regular day to day functional deliverables by the team.     Strong quantitative and qualitative analytic skills     Excellent written and verbal communication skills     Demonstrated ability to work in a team environment.     Ability to drive change and effectively handle multiple priorities.     Strong Management Competencies         Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:         MBA / Equivalent Post Graduation program in Business Management or Data Analytics (Offline, Online or Hybrid programs)     Advanced certified user of Data Analytics & Reporting Tools     Expert user in ERP, preferably Oracle

column2: As a Travel and Expense (T&E) Senior Manager, you will be responsible for setting the strategic direction and roadmap for the travel and expense function on a global scale     Your role involves driving enhancements and ensuring compliance with all T&E processes across the company     This encompasses the establishment of globally standardized T&E processes, both regionally and globally     It also involves responsibility to drive execution excellence within the Travel and Expense team, focused on meeting or exceeding defined success metrics and quality standards for deliverables and business outcomes     This leader must demonstrate strong communication with key members of Qualcomm s Global Accounting Organization and relevant Global Process Owners (GPOs) to deliver best-in-class execution and build a continuous improvement mindset into the organization     Additionally, you will oversee the management and development of staff, cultivate key relationships with end users and external vendors, ensure Sox compliance, and spearhead efforts to enhance departmental efficiencies and automation     The ideal candidate should also have a strong understanding and inclination towards automation possibilities in the T&E space, which includes, but is not restricted to, AI, any other form of efficiency in the said space                 PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES:         Manage all Travel and Expense activities, ensuring accurate, reliable, timely deliverables that meet or exceed quality standards, including but not limited to:       Actively monitor and manage:      Travel and expense management.     Periodic review of process metrics to ensure compliance to policies and global process.     Proactive communication with global stakeholders and businesses, to ensure compliance and reinforce the same to employees.     Regular escalations and training for Noncompliance to policies.     Period review of polices and process with the Global Process Owner and Operations Process Owner (OPO) to ensure consistency with market.     External benchmarking of policies and procedures to review and enhance best practices and implement efficient processes.         Drive achievement of metric targets and develop timely action plans to address any results that are out of compliance with established expectations.     Prepare audit documentation and perform analysis in support of the Company s various internal and external audit activities.     Manage relationships with our external partners and ensure their performance is in line with expectations.           Lead an organization with a strong focus on Compliance, accuracy and timeliness while seeking continuous improvements in the T&E process through:       Partnering with GPOs and Operations Process Owner (OPO) to recommend and implement innovative approaches that will provide a future road map for the T&E process with efficiency and compliance in mind.     Partnering with Regional and other stakeholders like HR & Legal to build a process around Non-Compliance.     Consistently provide guidance, mentorship and coaching to managers, Staff, and senior accountants in the T&E team, including drafting and conducting performance reviews and delivering real-time feedback throughout the year with a focus on employee development and career/organizational planning     Proactively identify and provide solutions for problems that arise, communicate such to OPO     Proactively identify situations and areas where to insert self into situations to resolve open issues or avoid escalations     Lead business initiatives and projects                   Essential Knowledge & Experience:           14+ years of applicable experience in Travel and Expense domain with additional experience in implementation of Concur.     Experience in implementation of AI based tools and Dashboards in the Travel and expense domain would be preferred.     Strong knowledge and understanding of overall accounting operations.     Strong PC skills with required proficiency in Microsoft Office applications.     Strong verbal, written and negotiation skills.     High degree of professionalism - able to interact verbally and in writing with all levels of the organization and with internal and external stakeholders (e.g. suppliers). Strong negotiation skills.     Prior experience working for a large multinational corporation, preferably one headquartered in the United States     Prior experience working in a Shared Service environment.     Extensive experience in a Supervisory role. (Managed greater than 10-member team)     Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)     Oracle and SAP experience a plus                       Minimum Qualifications:       Bachelors degree.   2+ years of Finance, Accounting, or related work experience.

column2: Common analytics by GBU and for Global functions to improve performance and cost management      Transversal data consolidation as well as more granular analyses      Common budget tools by GBU        - Facilitating a seamless integration of planning and actual data setting-up automation in reporting to enable Global Shared Services (SBS)        Support SBS strategy by implementing an end-to-end approach (e.g. Purchase to Pay P2P fully covered by integrated Group solutions from eBuy to AP Invoicing, T&E, etc.)      Opportunity to consolidate new activities in Shared Services (e.g. Master Data Management, Credit Management) and to develop global Shared Services organization models (e.g. T&E)      Support reporting factories        - Simplifying processes and Sanofi users experience        State-of-the-art global systems ensuring an end-to-end process integration while providing a simplified user s experience      Major changes to reporting or processes handled centrally at once      One source of truth on master data and a common automated internal control framework      Improved integration or divestment capabilities through a standardized methodology                  Job Summary:          The Functional Expert SAP S4HANA Finance will contribute to the design and the deployment of a single technical solution covering Finance s standardized processes for Account to Report (including Tax),          Procure to Pay and Customer Invoice to Cash in a single SAP solution for all businesses on all geographies.              The candidate will bring their expertise of business processes and SAP solutions, best practices and possible improvements.              The candidate will contribute, for his/her/their scope of responsibility within Finance, to solution design and to deliver all project deliverables under Solution Delivery responsibility (SAP solutions design, implementation in the systems, all related documentation), for the Projects he/she/they is assigned to, for Project duration.              Main responsibilities:              The main duties of the Functional Expert SAP S/4 HANA Finance are:                Ensure consistency of the solution for Domain and adherence to Standard and Core Model guiding principles (contribution to Design Authority).          Ensure that risks and issues are identified, formalized, and communicated to the Solution Delivery Controlling Team Lead.          Contribute to AMS activities (project handover, L3 support & solution validation)          Contribute to Integration topics with other domains.          Contribute to project delivery of the different project phases under the Co-Delivery model: scoping, design, build, testing, production cut over and post go live hyper care and knowledge transfer to AMS.          Ensure Solution documentation & capitalization of knowledge; contribute to Knowledge transfer and upskilling as required; provide inputs & proposals for documentation templates & deliverable formats evolutions.          Contribute to the improvement to project methodology together with the PMO team.          Contribute to handle Escalations with SAP, relationship with Max Attention team for Domain.          Correctly use the Program Tools for Domain (JIRA, HPALM, )                  Scoping              Lead with the Business Enablement to Scoping studies and Fit to Standard Workshops          Provide workload estimations for new scope to be deployed for Finance, or new functionalities to be implemented as part of Continuous Improvement                  Design of the Solution              Contribute with the Business Enablement team to the Global Design or Fit-Gap workshops in order to design the solution based on industry best practices, GBU & Global Support Functions business needs          Propose adequate SAP solutions minimizing gaps with the SAP standard functionalities by challenging business requirements and specify for customizing and development the agreed solutions          Perform impact analysis for application changes for SAP and satellites applications          Collect and consolidate impacts for legacy systems          Contribute to the design of transversal streams:              Master data management and migration strategy          Analytics          Authorizations          Process controls          UX          Other Solution delivery Domain for integration topics              Collect and consolidate all information on Finance required for Infrastructure and application landscape definition.          Deliver all design deliverables defined by the program and under Solution Delivery responsibility (e.g., Solution Documents, Functional specifications)          Develop him/herself on the new capabilities provided by SAP S4HANA on his/her perimeter; contribute to continuous improvement of the solution with Proof of Concepts (POCs).                  Development and testing              Organize, complete, unit-test and document the configuration of the system.          Contribute with the development team to the specific developments (functional specifications update & inputs for unit test)          Ensure quality of developments / Contribute to audits & quality KPI follow up.          Organize, document and execute integration and system tests          Contribute to user acceptance tests and finalize the solution (address defects identified)          Use properly the documentation and testing tools          Complete all deliverables defined by the program and under Solution Delivery responsibility (e.g., test protocols, test reports)                  Migration and go-live              Contribute to migration activities related to the stream          Document and execute cut-over activities related to the stream          Update training documents & contribute to trainings on the Solution          Ensure go-live support and hyper care activities          Handover to AMS: Lead the project transition to AMS for her/his functional domain (including knowledge transfer sessions and handover of ongoing incidents)                  AMS:              Contribute to AMS activities: provide functional expertise for complex topics and challenge / validate solution evolutions proposed by AMS team.          Cross- project activities          Support the Referent Expert for specific topics within Finance: Provide ad-hoc support to projects during Design phase and validate evolutions          Maintain all reference documentation up to date          Contribute to continuous improvement by keeping informed on new functionalities available for Finance Domain & contributing to Proof of Concepts / Prototypes                  Cross-project activities                  Be the Referent Expert for specific topics within Finance: Provide ad-hoc support to projects during Design phase and validate evolutions.          Maintain all reference documentation up to date          Contribute to continuous improvement by keeping informed on new functionalities available for Finance Domain & contributing to Proof of Concepts / Prototypes          Responsible to identify areas for Project industrialization and automation.          Play active role under Agile methodology (scrum master )                        Experience    :          12+ years of SAP experience with minimum 3 years in S/4 HANA platform          Knowledge of SAP S/4 Hana is mandatory          At least 3 full lifecycle SAP implementations (all phases)          Demonstrate a good track record in SAP design and customizing of finance modules          Understands and performs SAP system configuration as expert in Finance (FI) including:          Account to Report which includes GL settings, Cash Accounting, Fixed Assets, Closing and Reporting functionalties          Procure to Pay which includes Purchasing, AP Invoicing, Payments and Closing Activities          Customer Invoice to Cash which includes Credit Management, Invoice Management/Cash Application, Collections and Closing Activities              Experience with good change control practices for SAP customizing changes (including use of SolDoc, CHARM, etc.)          Knowledge of the integration of the finance modules with controlling, order to cash, purchasing and manufacturing processes preferably in a Pharmaceutical / Consumer Products industry is a plus          Experience in the analysis and design of Finance business processes, ideally within the pharmaceutical or similar industries is a plus          Knowledge of other SAP functional domains as advantage          Experience in Master Data management, IDocs/BAPIs, interfacing SAP with Legacy applications and program debug is a plus          Proven experience working in major IT consulting firms as an expert          Experience of SAP projects in complex and international environment          Knowledge of Agile Project methodologies and tools, i.e., JIRA, Confluence, etc. is a plus          Knowledge of Finance related applications (i.e., High Radius, Paymetrics, Concur, Coupa, Blackline, etc.) is a plus          Solid understanding of financial accounting principles, business processes, and best practices.          At ease with Microsoft Office tools, and in general with IS tools                    Soft Skills    :          Team player, service-oriented, Solution-oriented, social skills, and strong ability to work in a team.          Dynamic, results driven.          Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business requirements into functional    specifications.        Active listener, able to challenge requirements.          Strong oral and written communication skills.          Rigorous, autonomous.          Accountability and Reliability.          Ability to evaluate risks & manage appropriate escalations.          Flexibility to travel up to maximum 20% of time.                Education    :          Bachelor s degree (required) or Master s degree (preferred) in finance, or in Supply chain, or in science, or in IT or in Engineering.                Languages    :          Fluent in English.          Any other language is a plus.

column2: The Finance Operation Process leader will drive establishing baseline processes, increasing efficiency and leading continuous improvement across the finance operations teams and develop appropriate performance indicators to convey fact-based success measurement     In this role, the Finance Operations Process leader will drive the injection of contemporary finance practices rooted in automation, data modeling and integrated business planning and reporting     This position typically works under limited supervision and direction     Incumbents of this position regularly exercise discretionary and regular decision-making authority                 Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:          Drives efficiency through adoption of a results-driven and non-bureaucratic mindset and also removes time-wasting tasks and activities     Develop and implement process solutions to improve operational efficiency and communication     Provide training programs on processes to ensure adoption across the teams     Ensure effective internal audits of processes to confirm documentation is relevant, up to date, and adhered to across organization     Monitor and measure the benefits of post process implementation to ensure product quality, efficiency, and improvement     Champion, develop and implement a continuous process improvement and automation focus to expand scope of services provided by the Finance Operations team with clear and demonstrable measurements of efficiency, security, and cost benefits     Well versed in contemporary finance practices including cloud-based solutions, automation, RPAs, data modeling, etc.     Lead project teams as needed that will be responsible for process assessments, and process design and redesign     Resolves complex problems and influences outcomes that align with business objectives     Promote a culture of high performance and continuous improvement and innovation that values learning and a commitment to quality     In addition to the duties and responsibilities listed, the job holder is required to perform other duties assigned by their manager from time-to-time, as may be reasonably required of them.             Minimum Job Requirements:          Four-year college degree in Accounting or Finance with at least seven to ten years progressive finance and accounting experience required, preferably in a large organization     An MBA and CPA Certification are highly desirable     Minimum of 5 years experience with general ledger, P&L and Balance Sheet     Ability to build strong partnerships with colleagues, customers, and suppliers     Ability to identify areas of under-performance and agree plans to rectify     Demonstrate experience of design and implementation of business process with a continuous improvement mindset     Must be initiative-taking, pragmatic, and able to work independently     Diligent and strong attention to detail     Strong influencing skills, able to problem solve and find effective and timely resolutions     Demonstrates excellent interpersonal skills with a willingness to share knowledge, coach and collaborate effectively with individuals and other departments     Strong organization and planning skills with the ability to multitask and ruthlessly prioritize     Financial experience in a manufacturing environment and service-based organization are highly desirable     Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or similar software, prior experience of SAP preferred but not essential     Able to protect and handle confidential personnel information     Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer required     Limited to travel including international

column2: ?           What will you do         Verification and Processing of Invoices:    Thoroughly review and process invoices for the respective Business Units (BUs).Ensure accuracy, completeness, and compliance with company policies and procedures. Collaborate with internal teams to resolve any discrepancies or issues related to invoices.       Monthly P&L and Balance Sheet Closure:    Lead the closure of monthly Profit and Loss (P&L) statements and Balance Sheet items for the assigned Business Units. Ensure all financial records are accurately recorded and reconciled to support timely financial reporting.       GST Reconciliation and Compliance:    Demonstrate a strong understanding of Goods and Services Tax (GST) regulations and requirements. Perform regular reconciliation of GST transactions with the GST portal, resolving any discrepancies.       TDS Deduction and Compliance:    Handle Tax Deducted at Source (TDS) deduction processes accurately and in compliance with regulations. Prepare and file quarterly and annual TDS returns, issuing TDS certificates as required.       Collaboration with Auditors:    Work closely with auditors to facilitate the timely completion of audits. Provide necessary documentation and information to auditors to support the audit process.       Process Automation and Scaling:    Identify opportunities to automate existing financial models and tools. Contribute to the enhancement and scalability of financial operations through automation.       Control and Efficiency Enhancements:    Proactively seek out opportunities to improve financial controls and operational efficiency. Implement best practices and processes to enhance overall financial management.               Who should apply for this role       Qualified Chartered Accountant with 5 Years of experience in finance and accounting roles.     Excellent knowledge of SAP system functionality and experience in extracting and analyzing financial data.     Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including the ability to work with complex formulas, pivot tables, and data visualization.

column2: Support and manage the monthly, quarterly, and year-end accounting close processes for revenue, including the review of journal entries, reconciliations, and other various reporting deliverables and preparation of relevant sections of the financial statements in accordance with US GAAP.     Assist in the management of the revenue team and manage relationships and workflows with operational teams.      Mentor, train and develop a growing revenue accounting operations team in India.     Assistant in management of the day-to-day activities of the revenue accounting team to ensure accurate and timely reporting.      Be a trusted business partner and advisor to various stakeholders across the business including sales, sales operations, services, legal, product management, FPA and IT. Actively engage with business partners to drive the review and evaluation of deal structures to ensure proper revenue recognition while promoting and maintaining positive customer relations. Provide thought leadership on revenue related to new product introductions and new business expansion.     Support sales transactions within the boundaries of ASC 606, but with an eye towards growing the top line.     Identify, analyze, and apply technical guidance primarily related to software and SaaS revenue recognition, owning accounting policies and memos related to revenue, and provide training to internal staff on technical accounting matters.     Develop and maintain effective internal controls to ensure compliance with Sarbanes-Oxley 404.     Be a proactive liaison with external auditors to drive timely closure of revenue accounting matters and annual audits and quarterly reviews.     Evaluate processes, and drive system implementation and enhancements including integrations from Salesforce, Zuora, RevPro, SAP and database tools.         You have         8+ years of relevant work experience with a combination of Big 4 and in a fast-paced, global, software/SaaS company. Public company experience is a plus.     Deep knowledge of U.S. GAAP and revenue recognition (ASC 606) or revenue from contracts with customers (Ind AS 115).     Experience using systems such as Salesforce, Zuora, RevPro, SAP Oracle.     Strong organizational skills with the ability to take ownership of projects and deadlines and hold others accountable to deadlines and deliverables.     Strong communication and interpersonal skills.     Degree in accounting - required, CPA preferred.     The ability to work well both independently and in a team environment, and the ability to interact effectively across the Company and with various business partners.

column2: The candidate must possess in-depth functional knowledge of the process area and apply it to operational scenarios to provide effective solutions. He/she must be able to identify discrepancies and propose optimal solutions by using a logical, systematic, and sequential methodology. It is vital to be open-minded towards inputs and views from team members and to effectively lead, control, and motivate groups towards company objects. Additionally, he/she must be self-directed, proactive, and seize every opportunity to meet internal and external customer needs and achieve customer satisfaction by effectively auditing processes, implementing best practices and process improvements, and utilizing the frameworks and tools available. Goals and thoughts must be clearly and concisely articulated and conveyed, verbally and in writing, to clients, colleagues, subordinates, and supervisors. Process Manager Roles & responsibilities: Ensure the timely event reporting of breaches and incidents and identification and implementation of preventative measures when issues arise Working closely with other relevant operations managers to ensure that process risks are minimised Carrying out independent quality checks and linking findings into training plans and regular feedback Work in full compliance with established processes Operating within strict regulatory timescales, agreed business SLAs and confidentiality standards Daily workload management, working with Team Manager to identify solutions if any SLA is under threat Escalate issues to client and internal managers to bring issues to their attention in a short span of time to avoid client escalation  Help knowledge management endeavour by sharing process knowledge and best practices within the teams  Functional & Technical Skills: Bachelor's Degree in B. Com /BBM or Masters Degree in M. Com/MBA/PGDM 6 to 9 years of experience in handling a team of a minimum of 25 members  Should have worked under DTCC settlements, MO, Corporate Action, Event Processing, Reconciliation and Settlements Should have basic knowledge of finance, trade life cycle, investment banking, and derivatives Should be good with logical and quantitative abilities

column1: Lead Analyst / Principal Analyst / Associate Director- Equity Research
column2: Lead Analyst / Principal Analyst / Associate Director - Equity Research / Financial Research Overview: We are seeking dynamic individuals to join company's Financial Research group in India. The positions are available within our Asset-Backed Securities (ABS) and Fundamental Equities (FIG) teams. These teams play a crucial role in generating new growth ideas and providing strategic insights for enhancing decision-making processes. Responsibilities: - Conduct research on specific companies and subsectors within sectors such as Banking, FIG, Specialty Finance, Housing, and Commercial Real Estate (CRE). - Collaborate with the front office team to develop and refine financial models, track news flows and sell-side research views, cover results, and prepare investment write-ups and presentations. - Conduct in-depth benchmarking of valuation and operational metrics, sensitivity and scenario analysis. - Attend management, sell-side, intermediary, and sector expert calls. Requirements: - Degree in finance or equivalent (Master of Business Administration/Chartered Financial Analyst/Chartered Accountant) with over 5 years of investment research experience in relevant sectors. - Strong financial modeling and accounting skills. - Experience in international markets, particularly the US and UK, is advantageous. - Good understanding of equity markets, fundamental analysis, and valuations. - Excellent written and verbal communication skills. - Exceptional analytical skills, attention to detail, self-motivation, and ability to interact effectively with trading desks and stakeholders. If you are a proactive and driven individual with a passion for equity research, we encourage you to apply.
column11: Equity Research, Investment Research, Financial Research, fundamental analysis, Equity Valuation, Financial Modeling, accounting

column2: F&B and Event Service Expert      Our jobs aren t just about putting food on the table or serving guests during a banquet or event.    Instead,  we want to build an experience that is memorable and unique - with food and drinks on the side.    Our F&B Service Experts is skilled in a wide range of event functions and able to take the initiative and deliver a wide range of services to make sure that guests  experience is well taken care of from start to finish.    Whether setting tables and event materials communicating with the kitchen,  interacting,  and serving guests,  or cleaning work areas and supplies,  the F&B Service Expert makes transactions feel like part of the experience.           Follow all company and safety and security policies and procedures; report maintenance needs,  accidents,  injuries,  and unsafe work conditions to manager; complete safety training and certifications.    Ensure uniform and personal appearance are clean and professional; maintain confidentiality of proprietary information; protect company assets.    Welcome and acknowledge all guests according to company standards.    Speak with others using clear and professional language.    Develop and maintain positive working relationships with others; support team to reach common goals.    Ensure adherence to quality expectations and standards.    Stand,  sit,  or walk for an extended period of time.    Reach overhead and below the knees,  including bending,  twisting,  pulling,  and stooping.    Move,  lift,  carry,  push,  pull,  and place objects weighing less than or equal to 25 pounds without assistance.    Perform other reasonable job duties as requested by Supervisors. column2: A career in our Managed Services team will provide you an opportunity to collaborate with a wide array of teams to help our clients implement and operate new capabilities, achieve operational efficiencies, and harness the power of technology     The Finance Accounting Managed Services team provides support by addressing the challenges of achieving appropriate standards of control, efficient back office opportunities, transforming finance function by executing strategies to reduce functional and operational complexity through streamlined processes, optimising use of technology, and efficiently using resources to deliver cost effective, high quality services to all stakeholders     The team delivers core finance accounting functions including Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Compliance and Controls, Fixed Assets, Project Accounting, General Accounting, Financial Planning and Analysis, Tax, and Treasury       As a Senior Manager, youll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:           Encourage everyone to have a voice and invite opinion from all, including quieter members of the team.     Deal effectively with ambiguous and unstructured problems and situations.     Initiate open and candid coaching conversations at all levels.     Move easily between big picture thinking and managing relevant detail.     Anticipate stakeholder needs, and develop and discuss potential solutions, even before the stakeholder realises they are required.     Contribute technical knowledge in area of specialism.     Contribute to an environment where people and technology thrive together to accomplish more than they could apart.     Navigate the complexities of cross-border and/or diverse teams and engagements.     Initiate and lead open conversations with teams, clients and stakeholders to build trust.     Uphold the firms code of ethics and business conduct.                             Preferred Knowledge/Skills:            Demonstrates intimate knowledge of, and/or success in managerial roles leading a team involving key business and strategic priorities leveraged to oversee a team providing financial managed services in the areas of procure to pay, record to report, and operate to cash.          Demonstrates strong leadership skills to effectively manage and develop diverse teams in meeting client needs Extensive] knowledge of P2P, O2C, and R2R end-to-end processes, including industry best practices Demonstrates the ability to analyze complex data, identify trends, and solve problems is \ to make informed decisions and drive process improvements.          Possess a solid understanding of financial principles and be able to interpret financial data to drive strategic decision-making within P2P, O2C, and R2R functions.          Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams, client global process owners, and PwC account management and leadership teams.          Strong interpersonal skills are also necessary to build and maintain relationships.          Demonstrates skill in managing change, driving process improvements, and implementing new technologies or systems.          Plans, executes, and monitor projects within P2P, O2C, and R2R functions for large, global clients Knowledge of relevant regulations and compliance and industry best practices to ensure adherence within P2P, O2C, and R2R functions.          Have a mindset focused on continuous improvement, seeking opportunities to streamline processes, enhance efficiency, and drive cost savings          Bachelors Degree in Accounting,          Accounting Finance, Finance 6+ years experience

Here s to the world ahead     Graebel is looking for a Manager who will be responsible for managing and leading a Client Financial Services team that receives, audits, disburses payment, invoices, and reports on relocation expenses on the behalf of worldwide clients, advances financial and business goals through workflow management, strategic planning, and exceptional team leadership         Required Skills           Directs staff and assist in the organization, creation, and execution of processes that are efficient, accurate, and of high quality. Manages for compliance to audit directives, client service level agreements, cycle time standards, quality goals, and client satisfaction targets. Adjusts workflow management strategies to prevent financial risks/penalties and adherence to deadlines. Responsible for the design and overall execution of process changes.      Ensures staffing is at optimal levels based on work volume, complexity, and forecasting. Interviews and makes hiring recommendations. Ensures staff is properly trained, with procedures documented and available to staff. Coaches staff in delivering excellence by creating an environment of commitment, openness, and team spirit. Uses escalations as appropriate for additional staff training or to improve processes.     Analyzes client and vendor contracts/processes which deviate from the "norm" and work with the team to develop customized processes, documents, and training to ensure compliance with those terms.   Create and modify training materials on all processes within the department. Along with the operating procedures, maintain a training video that follows the document. Create self sufficient training materials to be utilized by the frontline and external teams.      Initiates and supports projects to increase efficiency across all areas of CFS. Proactively works with all Graebel departments to meet company goals and objectives. Performs random audits to determine if standards are being maintained.     Manages New Client Implementations- This includes but is not limited to setting the client up in the financial system, attending client calls to discuss client requirements, mapping the policies in the system, training the different teams on specialized processes, reviewing the pricing matrix, etc Meeting with the internal teams weekly to ensure all teams are aligned. column2: The Finance Shared Services Leader will provide ongoing leadership for the Accounting and Cash Application teams at the finance shared services center based in Bangalore, India to complement its existing service centers.      The Bangalore location is the global hub of a network of service centers that operate under generally standard processes and procedures and utilize Oracle s ERP software solution.        The position will require significant process expertise related to shared service center operations.                          The process streams to be supported will be:                        AR Cash application collection support activity                    Fixed asset Cash accounting                    Intercompany accounting                    Expense accounting (S, GA)        The position will require extensive and effective communication across functions and with senior financial management, including the Chief Accounting Officer and financial personnel in our business lines and global operations.                Responsibilities:                      This Finance Shared Services Leader will be responsible for the Accounting and Cash Application team operations of Company s Bangalore based Shared Services Center, including continuous improvement of processes and internal controls as we'll as contributing to the overall vision for Company s shared services evolution.                    Manage the operations of the Accounting and Cash Application teams in the India Shared Service Centre including hiring and training staff, implementation of standard business processes and governance for identified processes in-scope as documented in our finance blueprint.                    Manage performance to targeted Global Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to align with delivery of desired service level to the business.                    Exercise fiscal oversight for the India Shared Service Centre.                    Manage the India Shared Service Centre in accordance with the established global service delivery model, operating model, process framework, and governance while also collaborating with other members of the shared services leadership team relative to our strategy around shared service capabilities and trends.                        Manage staff in accordance with Company policies and applicable local legislation, including planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance and guiding professional development; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing employee relations issues and resolving problems.                    Provide directional guidance to management team for all process areas included in the scope of shared services. Integrate finance processes of new acquisitions into the India Shared Service Centre.                    Work closely with teams across the shared services organization and in the business to identify and implement opportunities for efficiencies (including the ERP IT team).                    Manage ongoing finance operations while also taking on ad hoc projects.                    Provide Senior Finance Management globally and supported units with regular communication of performance against desired service levels.                    Represent Finance team on key committees as designated by the Chief Accounting Officer.                Behavioral Characteristics:                  Strong communication skills with the ability to work with cross-functional management (operations, sales, etc) and senior finance management.                  Ability to build a positive rapport with personnel throughout the global organization.                  High sense of urgency and ability to identify creative solutions to advanced, time sensitive problems by balancing achievement of process objectives with practical considerations.                  Strong customer service focus, with a drive to ensure that we exceed the expectations of our customers.                  High degree of organizational agility, able to handle sensitive issues with prudent discretion across all levels of the organization.                  Strong ability to implement best practices in back-office operations; commitment to driving competitive advantage while managing costs, improving quality, and managing risks.                  Commitment to delivering quality results and overcoming obstacles and challenges in a time-sensitive environment.                  Ability to juggle and prioritize multiple work streams while remaining calm and effective under pressure.                  Ability to develop, coach and support a team effectively with a strong focus on their career development.                  Exhibit a positive attitude and maintain poise under pressure.                      Qualifications:                  bachelors degree in accounting/finance with a CPA or Chartered Accountant certification or other similar qualification.                  Minimum of 15 years of relevant experience, including 6-10 years of experience in global shared service center leadership role.                      Strong technical accounting skills and demonstrated ability to work in SOX controlled environment.                  Knowledge of financial systems skills and reporting tools (experience with Oracle PeopleSoft a plus)

column2: MoveInSync is seeking a talented Chartered Accountant to join our Finance team as an Associate Manager. You will play a crucial role in monitoring trade receivables, optimizing tax benefits, and reviewing statutory compliance, among other important financial functions. We are looking for someone who excels in these and has a fun-loving personality. If you are ready for a challenging yet rewarding opportunity, this role is perfect for you.     What You ll Do:        Monitoring and managing the trade receivable team to ensure efficient and effective processing of receivables, minimizing credit risk, and maintaining a healthy cash flow.             Conducting regular reviews of GST transactions, credits, and debits and optimizing tax benefits to ensure compliance with GST regulations and maximize tax efficiency.             Tracking and reviewing all statutory compliances and payments, including tax filings, regulatory reporting, and legal requirements, to ensure timely and accurate submissions.             Reviewing and maintaining information security controls, particularly related to Tally back-ups, to safeguard financial data and ensure compliance with information security policies.             Monitoring and maintaining the Fixed Asset Register(FAR) and conducting periodic stock verifications to ensure accurate and up-to-date records of assets and inventory.             Providing support in secretarial functions, such as filing with the Registrar of Companies (ROC) and fulfilling compliance returns, to ensure adherence to legal and regulatory obligations.             Assisting in the monthly book closing process, including reconciling accounts, preparing financial statements, and ensuring accurate and timely reporting.             Monitoring and controlling the monthly balance sheet and trial balance to identify and resolve any discrepancies, ensuring accurate financial reporting.             Supporting the Head of Department (HOD) in the preparation of business plans and budgets, providing financial insights, analysis, and recommendations to facilitate strategic decision-making.             Preparing annual financial statements in compliance with GAAP format, including accompanying notes, to present accurate and comprehensive financial information.             Coordinating and completing the filing of Tax Audit reports, ensuring compliance with tax regulations and timely submission of required documents.             Managing the finance team, providing leadership, guidance, and support to ensure the smooth functioning of the department and achievement of financial goals.             Planning and executing statutory audits to obtain audited financial statements, ensuring compliance with auditing standards and regulations.       What Youll Need:        This position is open exclusively for individuals who hold the Chartered Accountant qualification, demonstrating expertise in financial management, accounting principles, and regulatory compliance.             Possess exceptional analytical skills to proficiently review and interpret financial data, identify patterns and trends, assess risks, and provide valuable insights for informed decision-making.             Display an in-depth understanding of statutory regulations, tax laws, and accounting principles to ensure meticulous adherence to legal and regulatory requirements.             Exhibit meticulous attention to detail to effectively track and review financial records, promptly identify discrepancies, and maintain data integrity.             Demonstrate proficient problem-solving skills to effectively identify and address financial issues, conduct root cause analysis, and implement suitable solutions.             Possess excellent written and verbal communication skills to convey financial information accurately, prepare comprehensive reports, and collaborate seamlessly with stakeholders at various organizational levels.             Exhibit proficiency in utilizing financial software and tools, including ERP systems, accounting software, and spreadsheet applications, to efficiently manage and analyze financial data.             Showcase strong leadership skills to successfully manage and motivate a finance team, offering guidance and support and fostering a collaborative work environment.             Display an ability to think strategically and contribute actively to business planning, budgeting, and decision-making processes within the finance domain.             Possess sound knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) to ensure accurate financial reporting and compliance with industry standards.             Proactively identify potential financial challenges, develop effective solutions, and implement robust controls and processes to mitigate risks and enhance overall financial performance.             Exhibit exceptional time management skills to prioritize tasks, meet deadlines, and efficiently manage multiple responsibilities within a dynamic work environment.             Demonstrate a comprehensive understanding of the organization s industry, market dynamics, and strategic business goals to provide valuable financial insights and contribute to strategic initiatives.       Advantages of Working in MoveinSync:        A fast-paced work environment with ample opportunity to learn and grow.              Flexible work timings in a hybrid setting             Competitive salary.             Free meals.

column1: BSP Assistant Manager - Fund Admin & Reporting
column2: Benefit Street Partners ("BSP") is a leading credit-focused alternative asset management firm with approximately $77 billion in assets under management. Established in 2008, the BSP platform manages funds for institutions, high-net-worth and retail investors across various strategies including: private/opportunistic debt, liquid loans, high yield, special situations, long-short liquid credit and commercial real estate debt. These complementary strategies leverage the proprietary sourcing, analytical, operational and compliance capabilities that encompass BSP s robust institutional platform. BSP s operational headquarters are located in Boston, MA and support the investment team located in New York, NY.       BSP is a wholly owned subsidiary of Franklin Resources, Inc. that, together with its various subsidiaries, operates as Franklin Templeton. Together we are dedicated to delivering strong results and exceptional service to clients, team members and business partners. For over 65 years, Franklin Templeton s success has been a direct result of the talent, skills, and persistence of our people, and we are looking for qualified candidates to join our team.         We are looking for a Fund Finance Assistant Manager to spearhead the creation and growth of our accounting team in Hyderabad. The team is initially expected to be made up of three individuals but has potential to grow. The successful candidate will report to the Finance Director at BSP. This role requires a proactive leader capable of operating independently and establishing effective communication channels with our Boston-based Fund Finance Directors.               What      are the ongoing responsibilities of      BSP Assistant Manager - Fund Admin & Reporting responsible for?           Help recruit, train, manage and develop a Fund Finance team to support the team in Boston.         Collaborate closely with the Fund Finance Directors in Boston to understand BSP products and requirements.         Communicate effectively with the Boston team on day-to-day workflow status, open items, questions, personnel, etc, navigating time zone differences as necessary.           Fund Finance responsibilities include, but are not limited to:           Reviewing quarterly/annual financial statements and workpapers provided by third party administrators including oversight of audit workflows.         Overseeing month-end closings to ensure accurate monthly and quarterly net asset values, management fees, carried interest, expense accruals, etc         Maintaining our shadow accounting system         Reconciling of cash and position, working with counterparties and third-party vendors.         Collaborating and building strong relationships with various teams across BSP including Liquidity, Valuation, Portfolio Analytics, Legal, Tax, Management Company, GP, Business Development, Operations, and Investment Professionals.         Management reporting, board reporting, and other ad-hoc project work focusing on operational efficiencies.               What ideal qualifications, skills & experience would help someone to be successful           7-8+ years of experience working in financial services, including time specifically supporting Alternative Credit funds.         Expertise in partnership accounting including closed-ended and open-ended funds, BDCs a plus.         Educated to degree level or equivalent.         Qualified chartered accountant - ACCA / ACA / CIMA or equivalent.         A strong track record of leadership and team management, demonstrating the ability to motivate and develop a high-performing team.         Exceptional analytical, strategic thinking, and problem-solving skills along with strong mathematical skills as we'll as proficiency in Excel.         Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interface effectively with all levels of the organization and with external partners.         A willingness to take on direct project work in addition to performing managerial responsibilities

column2: At IBM, we know that transformation drives change, and it is in our DNA to continuously transform. Our Business Transformation Consultants help drive large scale change that spans IBM business units and geographies. As a part of this team, you will have the unique opportunity to be a part of driving IBM's ongoing transformation as a company that continuously innovates and leads the market. Your Role and Responsibilities We are seeking a highly experienced and driven Global Process Owner to lead the transformation of our Order to Cash (O2C) processes within our finance and accounting function. The successful candidate will be responsible for driving the analysis, design, and implementation of process improvements across multiple business divisions and regions, including the Americas, EMEA, and APAC. This role requires a strong leader who can influence, and impact work delivered from multiple centers across US and Chennai, India, and collaborate with multiple senior stakeholders at the client end. Lead the transformation of the O2C process, focusing on optimizing efficiency, reducing costs, and enhancing customer satisfaction. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify areas of improvement and develop strategic plans to achieve process excellence. Develop and implement global standards, policies, and procedures for the O2C process, ensuring compliance with financial regulations and industry best practices. Work closely with senior stakeholders to understand their requirements and ensure that the O2C process meets their needs. Apply experience with large scale SAP S/4HANA migration to identify potential risks and its process impact Contextualize Order to Cash processes such as collections, dispute resolution, etc. such that it highlights root causes for resolution.  Analyze different reports to infer impact on the processes and underlying dependencies.  Articulate insights and recommendations to different sets of stakeholders, including business and technical audiences. Drive the analysis and implementation of technology solutions to enhance the O2C process, including automation and AI Monitor and report on key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of process improvements and identify areas for further enhancement. Required Technical and Professional Expertise Bachelor's degree in finance, Accounting, or a related field; MBA or relevant postgraduate qualification preferred. Minimum 10 years of experience in finance and accounting, with a focus on O2C processes. Proven experience in leading and managing global process improvement initiatives, preferably in FMCG industry. Strong knowledge of Order to cash AR management including SOX, and industry best practices. Excellent leadership and management skills, with experience in managing cross-functional teams. Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to influence and impact stakeholders at all levels. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with experience in data analysis and interpretation. Proficiency in MS Office, particularly Excel, and experience with financial systems- SAP Ability to travel as needed, up to 20% of the time. Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise None

column2: The Global Process Manager (GPM) - Record to Report (R2R) is responsible for driving global process standardization, transactional efficiency, organizational capability, process performance, and a prioritized roadmap of all global R2R processes. The position assures that quality, operation, and customer satisfactions objectives are achieved. The position analyzes policy with policy-owner (Corporate Finance), streamlines process to support policy and establishes key performance indicators for the global R2R processes. This role has accountability for R2R process excellence and is expected to provide the R2R GPO with recommendations to drive change across assigned disciplines.                                Key Responsibilities                              Define and implement the global R2R process roadmap to deliver targeted business benefits and ease of process use for the end user. Key sub-process components include month end closing, journal entries, account reconciliations, Intercompany, Fixed Assets, lease and Cash and Banking.                         Influence and align with R2R GPO on potential R2R process changes.                         Provide insights into shaping policies related to R2R process and institute process improvements to drive improved adherence to policies.                        Define and implement KPIs and performance measures associated with the R2R process. Lead benchmarking activities and continuous assessment of global process performance measures, driving measurable improvements in the process over time.                       Support R2R GPO in any system implementation / enhancement initiatives to the extent impacting R2R process.                          Identify, drive, and monitor continuous improvement related to the R2R process and create opportunities to bring service innovation to Kohler Co.                          Ensure adequate and timely root cause analysis to understand problem drivers and implementation of necessary corrections and/or changes.                          Identify and drive process automation including robotics for the process area.                         In consultation with business/functions and service delivery teams, support the identification, prioritization and implementation of process improvements, to drive better business outcomes.                         Establish and sustain process change control for R2R processes.                         Provide R2R process expertise for shared service migrations, business integrations including M&A activities.                         Build and maintain partnerships with process technology partners.                               The Person - Qualifications & Experience                               BS degree in Accounting, Finance, or General Management, or relevant work experience.                                 Minimum 5 years of Finance and Accounting experience in a complex, global organization.                                  Minimum 5 years of experience related to close, inclusive of all financial reporting.                                 Demonstrated experience working in a matrixed global environment.                                 Stakeholder management experience with ability to influence and persuade key stakeholder and to constructively deal with conflicts.                                 Full P&L and Balance sheet experience for a complex global organization a plus.                                 Strong understanding of compliance and background in designing and implementing financial controls.                                  In-depth understanding of SAP or other major ERP systems capabilities.                                 In-depth understanding of month-end close processes, KPIs for driving improvements, governance cadence and driving process improvements to remove friction in closing.                                  Strong understanding of specific accounting processes like Intercompany, fixed assets, lease, journal entries, account reconciliations, and cash and banking.                                 Demonstrable experience of executing process transformation initiatives or delivering enterprise systems.                                 Experience with implementation of RPA technologies within R2R desirable.                                 Program and project management experience required.                                 Formal continuous improvement (e.g. Lean / Six Sigma) desirable.                                 Strong written and oral communication skills.

column2: Genpact (NYSE: G) is aglobal professional services and solutions firm delivering outcomes that shapethe future. Our 125,000+ people across 30+ countries are driven by our innatecuriosity, entrepreneurial agility, and desire to create lasting value forclients. Powered by our purpose the relentless pursuit of a world that worksbetter for people we serve and transform leading enterprises, including theFortune Global 500, with our deep business and industry knowledge, digitaloperations services, and expertise in data, technology, and AI.   Inviting applications for the role of AM/Manager/SM,Financial Planning & Analysis   Financeis responsible for the accounting, tax, financial plans and policies of theorganization, establishing and maintaining fiscal controls, preparing andinterpreting financial reports, oversight of financial systems, strategicdecisions and support, and safeguarding the organization's assets.   FinancialPlanning & Analysis is responsible for being objective and strategicfinancial partners, leading cross-functional effort to drive relevant, flexibleand efficient financial planning and analysis that supports our key businessdecisions.     Analyzes business trends; leads and aligns  financial forecasts and long-range planning  processes with our business leaders. Drives business value by providing financial and analytical counsel to facilitate decision-making around strategic business initiatives.   Prepares  monthly financial reporting  including variance and financial statement analysis. Able to clearly communicate a cohesive and concise story around  business drivers  behind financial data and potential implications on future results.   Builds  financial models  and scenarios as a key input for business planning decisions in areas such as capital deployment, sourcing, product development, marketing strategies, and acquisitions.   Handles  annual budget processes , incorporating business initiatives, economic trends and operational efficiency. Aligns' budget to business strategies and gains alignment from business partners.   Performs customer and product  profitability analysis  and makes investment and pricing decisions. Finds opportunities to drive revenue growth, margin expansion and a more favorable mix (i.e., driving preferred products and services).   Understands  market dynamics  and competitors. Conducts sophisticated analysis, synthesizes and summarizes implications to business, influencing business partners using analytics and business understanding.   Identifies and executes upon operational  improvement opportunities . Demonstrates proficiency of technical tools and financial systems.   Serves as an objective financial steward with an enterprise perspective, safeguarding our company's assets.  Ensures controls  are in place and the company's intellectual property is protected.   Facilitate the  annual budget  and  quarterly forecast  process, including analysis of consolidated projections and preparing management-level presentations   Manage departmental  cost center budgets  and serve as a finance business partner to the respective budget owners   Develop and deliver robust, consistent and accurate analysis of business performance using  KPI dashboards  and non-financial data to highlight performance   Analyze data and facilitate sound management decisions through financial and metric reporting while highlighting material variances, trends, & risks/opportunities, and providing insightful commentary to the business and partners     Responsibilities     Is well versed with above mentioned work processes   Business partnering - partner with leaders to supervise and analyze business performance, find opportunities for improvement, and project future financial performance   Market analysis ??review, analyze, and communicate to leadership market trends, competitor positioning, and market opportunities    Reporting ??prepare monthly/quarterly/annual financial reports, including financial statement, variance analysis, and key business drivers   Budgeting and forecasting ??facilitate the process that aligns with Corporate and business unit guidance and targets, including the impact of market trends, key business initiatives and drivers, and operational dynamics    Communications ??proactively engage, align and support related functions, such as Controllership, management and external reporting, audit, and organizational initiatives   Operational improvement ??identify and execute improvement opportunities that improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the FP&A process. Ability to drive adoption of the standardized and streamlined reporting packs in consultation with business stakeholders   Policies and procedures ??review, monitor and lead all aspects of compliance with finance accounting policies and procedures, including the risk and control environment   Dynamic environment ??exhibit proactive and leadership skills that are flexible and adaptable to a changing business dynamic   Track utilization of the team and proactively plan for trainings & learning sessions during lean period.   Qualifications     Desired Educational Background: Qualified ICWA/CFA/ MBA (Finance)/CA/CA (Inter)/ICWA (Inter)/B.com with  6-8 years of experience in FP&A   skills     Relevant domain experience    Proficiency in FP&A reporting and forecasting tools, and Excel/ PowerPoint   Positive attitude and solutions-oriented approach.   Ability and desire to be hands on in an entrepreneurial, fast-paced environment   Ability to manipulate and model large volumes of data, interpret and identify pertinent issues   Advanced proficiency level in Excel (advanced formulas; pivot tables; modelling, etc.) and PowerPoint (presenting information in a meaningful & concise manner)   Adaptive, Tableau and NetSuite experience highly preferred   CRM experience; Sales Force experience highly preferred   Strong analytical skills and critical thinking ability   Effective interpersonal skills   Ability to work with and influence non-finance teams based on robust data and analysis   ? Ability to maintain a high level of accuracy in performing all essential duties and strong attention to detail   Should have strong communication skills (Verbal and Written)   Shift Time (Work window): US shifts???????????    Location: PUNE     Genpact is anEqual Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions withoutregard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin,citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, geneticinformation, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disabilityor any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.  Genpact iscommitted to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity andinclusion, respect and integrity, customer focus, and innovation. For moreinformation, visit www.genpact.com. Follow us on Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn,and YouTube.   Furthermore, please do note that Genpact does notcharge fees to process job applications and applicants are not required to payto participate in our hiring process in any other way. column2: MoveInSync is seeking a talented Chartered Accountant to join our Finance team as an Associate Manager. You will play a crucial role in monitoring trade receivables, optimizing tax benefits, and reviewing statutory compliance, among other important financial functions. We are looking for someone who excels in these and has a fun-loving personality. If you are ready for a challenging yet rewarding opportunity, this role is perfect for you.     What You ll Do:        Monitoring and managing the trade receivable team to ensure efficient and effective processing of receivables, minimizing credit risk, and maintaining a healthy cash flow.             Conducting regular reviews of GST transactions, credits, and debits and optimizing tax benefits to ensure compliance with GST regulations and maximize tax efficiency.             Tracking and reviewing all statutory compliances and payments, including tax filings, regulatory reporting, and legal requirements, to ensure timely and accurate submissions.             Reviewing and maintaining information security controls, particularly related to Tally back-ups, to safeguard financial data and ensure compliance with information security policies.             Monitoring and maintaining the Fixed Asset Register(FAR) and conducting periodic stock verifications to ensure accurate and up-to-date records of assets and inventory.             Providing support in secretarial functions, such as filing with the Registrar of Companies (ROC) and fulfilling compliance returns, to ensure adherence to legal and regulatory obligations.             Assisting in the monthly book closing process, including reconciling accounts, preparing financial statements, and ensuring accurate and timely reporting.             Monitoring and controlling the monthly balance sheet and trial balance to identify and resolve any discrepancies, ensuring accurate financial reporting.             Supporting the Head of Department (HOD) in the preparation of business plans and budgets, providing financial insights, analysis, and recommendations to facilitate strategic decision-making.             Preparing annual financial statements in compliance with GAAP format, including accompanying notes, to present accurate and comprehensive financial information.             Coordinating and completing the filing of Tax Audit reports, ensuring compliance with tax regulations and timely submission of required documents.             Managing the finance team, providing leadership, guidance, and support to ensure the smooth functioning of the department and achievement of financial goals.             Planning and executing statutory audits to obtain audited financial statements, ensuring compliance with auditing standards and regulations.       What Youll Need:        This position is open exclusively for individuals who hold the Chartered Accountant qualification, demonstrating expertise in financial management, accounting principles, and regulatory compliance.             Possess exceptional analytical skills to proficiently review and interpret financial data, identify patterns and trends, assess risks, and provide valuable insights for informed decision-making.             Display an in-depth understanding of statutory regulations, tax laws, and accounting principles to ensure meticulous adherence to legal and regulatory requirements.             Exhibit meticulous attention to detail to effectively track and review financial records, promptly identify discrepancies, and maintain data integrity.             Demonstrate proficient problem-solving skills to effectively identify and address financial issues, conduct root cause analysis, and implement suitable solutions.             Possess excellent written and verbal communication skills to convey financial information accurately, prepare comprehensive reports, and collaborate seamlessly with stakeholders at various organizational levels.             Exhibit proficiency in utilizing financial software and tools, including ERP systems, accounting software, and spreadsheet applications, to efficiently manage and analyze financial data.             Showcase strong leadership skills to successfully manage and motivate a finance team, offering guidance and support and fostering a collaborative work environment.             Display an ability to think strategically and contribute actively to business planning, budgeting, and decision-making processes within the finance domain.             Possess sound knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) to ensure accurate financial reporting and compliance with industry standards.             Proactively identify potential financial challenges, develop effective solutions, and implement robust controls and processes to mitigate risks and enhance overall financial performance.             Exhibit exceptional time management skills to prioritize tasks, meet deadlines, and efficiently manage multiple responsibilities within a dynamic work environment.             Demonstrate a comprehensive understanding of the organization s industry, market dynamics, and strategic business goals to provide valuable financial insights and contribute to strategic initiatives.       Advantages of Working in MoveinSync:        A fast-paced work environment with ample opportunity to learn and grow.              Flexible work timings in a hybrid setting             Competitive salary.             Free meals.

Involves the ability to assess materiality and volatility of financial statement line items and key metrics utilizing financial ratios to determine the financial health of the company. What are we looking for? Financial Planning and Analysis Thought leadership Negotiation skills Risk management Ability to manage multiple stakeholders Process-orientation Finance Strategy  Roles and Responsibilities: In this role you are required to identify and assess complex problems for area(s) of responsibility The individual should create solutions in situations in which analysis requires in-depth knowledge of organizational objectives Requires involvement in setting strategic direction to establish near-term goals for area(s) of responsibility Interaction is with senior management levels at a client and/or within Accenture, involving negotiating or influencing on significant matters Should have latitude in decision-making and determination of objectives and approaches to critical assignments Their decisions have a lasting impact on area of responsibility with the potential to impact areas outside of own responsibility Individual manages large teams and/or work efforts (if in an individual contributor role) at a client or within Accenture Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts Qualification Master of Business Administration

column2: Skill required:  Finance Transition Services - Finance Strategy Designation:  Finance Transition Svcs Manager Qualifications: Chartered Accountant,Master of Business Administration,Master of Business Administration  Years of Experience: 12+  What would you do? Finance Transition Services (FTS)Leveraging deep financial expertise and proven workplans, FTS sets up new or transforms existing or acquired financial management processes, bringing them in line with Accenture standards, enforcing operational excellence & compliance and driving profitability growth. FTS professionals work with Senior Management throughout the firm, across all types of organic and inorganic transactions, across all Geographies.Finance Transition Services (FTS) Manager can expect to work on the following deal profiles:Organic deals:o Large new contracts in start-up phaseo Poorly performing financial contracts with enhanced complexity or riskInorganic deals:Finance integration activities on Ventures and Acquisitions / Divestitures What are we looking for? 13+ years of experience in a financial role Strong organizational and analytical skills  Ability to be flexible and work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment Excellent customer service skills Good interpersonal and teamwork skills. Proven ability to supervise junior team members Deep knowledge of business, finance and accounting fundamentals including U.S. Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) SAP S4/ Hana experience Advanced Business English language (written and oral)  Advanced Microsoft Excel skills  Roles and Responsibilities:  Finance Transition Services (FTS) Manager can expect to lead work efforts and change management in the following areas: Individual contract and portfolios of contracts:Gather and document business case assumptions. Establish workplan taking into account both Accenture standard requirements as well as contract specifics. Design and setup appropriate hierarchy structure for contract in Accenture's ERP Implement standard Accenture digital financial tool-set Design and establish project best practice financial processes including roles and responsibilities. Define ongoing finance support roles and responsibilities and ensure smooth handover and coaching from FTS. Overall integration activities on Ventures and Acquisitions Establish appropriate hierarchy structure for both contract and non-contract financials in Accenture's ERP Provide leadership in new business processes by developing and implementing sound pricing fundamentals for new and extended opportunities. Perform or supervise preparation of program reporting as well as Accenture internal financial accounting processes. Manage corporate forecasting activities as defined by Accenture as well ad hoc and internal stakeholder management requests. Execute all global and local statutory, tax, Internal Controls, and US GAAP requirements as described by policy to ensure full compliance. Provide full management of P&L from revenue to operating income (including non-contract costs) Ensure balance sheet accountability. Qualification Chartered Accountant,Master of Business Administration,Master of Business Administration
