column2: We are seeking a motivated and qualified CA to join our growing audit team. This is an excellent opportunity for a recent graduate or someone with up to 1 year of post-qualification experience to gain valuable exposure to the BFSI industry. In this role, you will play a key role in assisting with various audit engagements for our clients.       Responsibilities:     Participate in the planning, execution, and finalization of audits for clients in the BFSI sector.   Perform analytical procedures to assess internal controls and identify potential risks.   Prepare audit working papers, including detailed documentation of audit procedures performed and findings.   Assist with the preparation of financial statements and ensure adherence to accounting standards.   Communicate effectively with clients and colleagues to gather information and resolve audit queries.   Stay up-to-date on the latest pronouncements issued by the Institute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI) and relevant accounting standards applicable to the BFSI sector.       Qualifications:     Chartered Accountant (CA) qualification from ICAI.   Bachelors degree in Commerce, Accounting, or a related field (preferably).   0-1 year of post-qualification experience in audit, ideally with a focus on BFSI clients (highly preferred).   Strong understanding of Indian Accounting Standards (Ind AS) and auditing methodologies.   Proficiency in MS Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).   Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.   Strong attention to detail and accuracy.   Ability to work independently and as part of a team.   Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

column2: JOB SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS: 1. CA Inter with 8 to 12 years of experience (CA Inter would be an added advantage) 2. Should have transition exposure. Experience in top CA firms or in multinational organization is preferred. 3. Should have managed a team of 5+ members for 4 years plus (will be added advantage). 4. Demonstrates project management and skills. 5. Demonstrates the ability to manage multiple clients and diverse team. 6. Excellent stakeholder management skills and interpersonal skills. 7. Good command over written and spoken English. 8. Core Experience in Record to Report with in depth knowledge in month close entries, consolidation, revenue (US GAAP, IFRS), GAAP adjustment entries. JOB DESCRIPTION A. OPERATIONS MANAGEMENT: 1. Procure to Pay. 2. Order to Cash. 3. Record to Report. B. CLIENT RELATIONSHIP MANAGEMENT: 1. Establish and continually seek opportunity to increase customer satisfaction and deepen client relationships. 2. Set and manage client expectations by communicating to each stakeholder at every step of the project. 3. Communicate effectively with clients to identify business needs and evaluate alternative business solutions. 4. Build knowledge base of each client business, organisation and objectives. 5. Establish channels for regular client feedback and satisfaction levels on the services provided, team/individual performance. 6. Have ability to design / create KPI reports and dashboards for client and management review. 7. Regular review of client processes documentation and keeping the same in live status. C. INTERNAL & EXTERNAL COMPLIANCES: 1. Comply with the company ethics policy. 2. Create awareness of ethical issues and encourage a transparent culture in which organisation ethics policy is understood and lived upon. 3. Prevent and manage any ethical issues as they arise. 4. Prevent conflict of interest problems. D. PLANNING, INTERNAL ADMINISTRATION & REPORTING 1. Participate, coach, guide the team in the initial creation of documentation for the client as part of deliverables and later review the documentation prepared by the team. 2. Review, evaluate and signoff all key deliverables to the client to ensure high quality output to the client. 3. Proactively identify, track, manage and mitigate the risks on specific issues with respect to client deliverables. 4. Resolve the issues by providing contingency plan and/or escalate the issues to the top management for alternate solutions to ensure minimal impact to quality and timeline. E. RESOURCE MANAGEMENT 1. Determine the roles of team members required for the execution of the tasks based on the requirement, timelines and budget as set in the client charter. 2. Determine the competencies/skills required for the execution of the tasks based on the client specification and requirement. 3. Determine the software/hardware resources, facilities required based on client work specification. 4. Identify the knowledge and skills required for execution of task and ensure the same is available and if not it is provided to team members. F. COMMUNICATION 1. Effectively communicate to the client the expectations, deliverables, dependencies, risks, timelines, milestones, schedules. 2. Conduct regular team meetings to: a. appraises the team of all the client activities in a timely manner. b. communicates roles and expectations to team members. c. address operational issues, personal grievances coming up from the team. G. TEAM MANAGEMENT 1. Ensure that all team members are adequately trained to perform their responsibilities and operational tasks in an ethical and responsible manner. 2. Review performance goals, achievements and concerns with each direct reporting staff on a regular basis. 3. Motivate and develop team members to shoulder higher responsibilities. 4. Establish channels for regular client feedback and satisfaction levels on the services provided and team/individual performance. Qualifications MANDATORY SKILLS: Maintaining financial controls and reporting in accordance with company and Client requirements. To take the lead in the understanding, interpreting, communicating, and delivering efficient accounting service commitments to client and company by effectively engaging and developing the team. Additional information KEY PERFORMANCE AREAS:  A. Operations Management B. Client Relationship Management C. Internal & External Compliances D. Planning, Internal Administration & Reporting E. Resource Management F. Communication G. Team Management

column2: In this role, MongoDB is looking for an energetic and enthusiastic Payroll Tax Compliance Manager, to join our global tax team. Responsibilities:       Act as an advisor to the payroll operations team for all payroll tax related matters     Operate as a subject matter expert of the payroll tax treatment of compensation & benefits and equity in compliance with global payroll guidance with a particular focus on our APAC countries     Work with the payroll team to ensure compliance with statutory payroll tax reporting requirements globally     Proactively advise the business on payroll tax compliance issues and opportunities liaising with external advisors where necessary     Work closely with HR, Comp & Bens and Payroll teams on continuous process improvement and development to ensure payroll tax compliance     Partner with the global mobility team on tax aspects associated with globally mobile employees and remote working     Work with the payroll and stock administration teams to analyze, optimize and automate existing payroll and equity tax compliance and global mobility tracking processes     Work with the Travel & Expense team to ensure we are meeting all statutory requirements and that expense reimbursements are correctly treated for payroll tax     Lead on any non standard payroll tax Financial Reporting:                Provide analysis to support for Revenue by account and by client and US GAAP/ IFRS                            Monthly / Quarterly Financial Close:                            o Review daily bank statement                          o Review wires to move funds between MIM accounts                          o Download the monthly bank statements identified accounts. column2: We are looking for an Accounting Operations Manager to play a key role in the digital transformation of the Finance Organization. This position has two key responsibilities 1) individual contributor work focusing on project/program management and 2) overseeing day-to-day operations of our India Accounting Ops team.       As an internally focused "Project/Program Manager" and part of the Accounting Operations team, this role works closely with accounting and cross-functional stakeholders, TechOps, and third party teams to optimize systems and processes that drive the company. Many of the projects focus on new finance system rollouts, process improvements, and automation initiatives.      As a people manager and leader, this role will have 2+ direct reports. This role is expected to engage, monitor, and develop their team of project managers . The Accounting Operations Manager will be responsible for the success and growth of their team.        This role should be comfortable with ambiguity and can "connect the dots" using their experience and expertise to build process solutions. This role will have high visibility into multiple parts of the organization, including but not limited to Accounting, Finance, Deal Desk, Legal, Professional Services, and TechOps and work on operational initiatives that will have a direct impact on the companys strategic goals.              The right candidate will have:         10+ years of experience in Project/Program Management, focusing on Finance Technology      A proven track record of bringing about process improvements to enterprise-wide business initiatives     Demonstrated experience in the full project and program management lifecycle: roadmapping, prioritization, requirement gathering, documentation, cross-functional development work, UAT, change management, and retrospectives     Ability to manage varied, and at times conflicting, stakeholder needs and requirements for new initiatives     Ability to recognize patterns across internal requirements and leverage them to provide solutions with maximal impact     Experience with developing best-in-class business processes to optimize use of enterprise SaaS solutions including but not limited to Netsuite, Salesforce, FinancialForce, Graphite, Coupa, and Xactly     Intrinsic drive to lead others to achieve a goal     Direct people leadership experience     Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment     Knowledge of internal controls and compliance requirements     Experience working in a complex enterprise SaaS sales company (Plus)     Experience using SmartSheet tool for project/program management      Bachelors degree in accounting, finance, or business administration       PMP Certification or similar certifications (Required)     Lean Six Sigma (Plus)     Chartered Accountant (Plus)           Position Responsibilities       Serve as the single point of contact on behalf of Accounting Operations for large cross-functional projects/programs.       Act as Program or Project Manager for cross-functional initiatives     Define project purpose, scope, and feasibility     Document business requirements into user/functional requirements used by internal and external resource teams     Create documentation including: project charters, product descriptions, project schedule, budget, policies, procedures, workflows, user guides, etc     Track, review, and regulate the progress and performance of projects     Finalize project activities and document reflections/retrospectives       Stay up-to-date on new concepts and emerging technologies in the Finance Transformation space     Ability to create positive relationships and influence internal and external customers     Effectively train and manage direct reports, including assignment of projects and path of escalation     Responsible for performance and growth reviews for direct reports     Allocate projects and resources to your direct reports
column11: Change management, PMP, Automation, Data management, Accounting operations, Manager Program Management, Management, Operations, Salesforce, Lean six sigma

column2: Graduate or Postgraduate in Accounting or relevant stream        4 - 6 years of experience in banking and financial services sector          Exposure to Auto Loans / LoanServices from a domain perspective            Advanced analytical skills to analyze complex financial data and identify trends or anomalies            Provide leadership and guidance to a team of indirect loan funding analysts, fostering a positive and collaborative work environment            Develop and implement effective workflows to streamline the loan funding process. Monitor and adjust processes as needed to improve efficiency            Supervise the administration of escrow accounts associated with retail loans, including the analysis, reconciliation, and resolution of any discrepancies.            Ensure that the team is well-versed in and compliant with relevant regulations including Truth in Lending Act (TILA), Equal Credit Opportunity Act (ECOA)            Prepare the team for internal and external audits, ensuring that documentation is accurate, complete, and readily available.            Strong interpersonal, customer service and coaching skills, ability to manage a team and form and maintain client and business relationships            Discretion and a dedication to protecting the financial privacy of clients, business partners, and employer                    Requirements              Loan Processing Expertise: In-depth knowledgeand experience in processing indirect loans, including understanding loan documentation, compliance requirements, and loan origination systems.          Leadership Skills: Ability to lead and manage ateam effectively, delegate tasks, provide guidance, and foster a positive workenvironment.          Communication Skills: Strong verbal and writtencommunication skills to effectively interact with team members, otherdepartments, senior management, and external stakeholders.          Training and Development: Capability to trainand mentor team members, conduct performance evaluations, and provideconstructive feedback to enhance individual and team performance.          Problem-Solving Abilities: Aptitude foridentifying issues, analyzing problems, and implementing effective solutions tostreamline processes, improve efficiency, and mitigate risks.          Attention to Detail: Keen attention to detail toreview loan documents accurately, ensure compliance with regulations andinternal policies, and minimize errors in loan processing.          Time Management: Excellent organizational andtime management skills to prioritize tasks, meet deadlines, and handle multipleprojects simultaneously.          Risk Management: Understanding of riskassessment principles and strategies to identify potential risks, implementcontrols, and ensure the integrity of the loan portfolio.          Regulatory Compliance: Knowledge of relevantregulatory requirements, such as TILA, FCRA, ECOA, and others, to ensurecompliance and mitigate legal risks.

column2: Goa Institute Of Management is looking for Senior Professor to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      Teaching and Instruction: Conduct lectures, seminars, and workshops for undergraduate and graduate students in your area of expertise      Research and Publications: Lead or contribute to research projects, publish scholarly papers, and secure grants to advance knowledge in your field      Mentorship and Advising: Mentor and advise students, guiding their academic and research pursuits      Curriculum Development: Contribute to the development and enhancement of academic programs and curricula      Departmental Leadership: Provide leadership within your department, serving on committees, and contributing to institutional decision-making      Collaboration: Foster collaboration with other faculty members, researchers, and external institutions to promote academic excellence      Professional Engagement: Engage in conferences, seminars, and professional associations to stay updated in your field        Required Skills and Qualifications:        Expertise in Field: Extensive knowledge and expertise in a specific academic discipline or field of study      Teaching Experience: Proven experience in teaching, curriculum development, and student mentorship      Research Acumen: Strong research background with a history of publications and research grants      Leadership Abilities: Leadership and administrative skills to contribute to academic governance

column2: We are seeking a highly skilled SAP Treasury Expert to join our finance or IT team      The SAP Treasury Expert will play a critical role in optimizing our financial operations by leveraging SAP Treasury Management functionalities      This position will be responsible for managing and enhancing our SAP Treasury system, ensuring compliance with financial regulations, and providing expert guidance to the finance and treasury teams                  Key responsibilities:        Maintain and optimize SAP Treasury Management module.      Configure and customize SAP Treasury functionalities to meet business requirements.      Troubleshoot and resolve SAP Treasury system issues.      Monitor and manage daily cash positions.      Implement cash forecasting and cash flow analysis.      Optimize cash concentration and disbursement processes.      Implement risk management strategies using SAP Treasury.      Monitor and manage interest rate, currency, and commodity risks.      Ensure compliance with risk management policies and regulations.      Manage payment processes and bank communications through SAP Treasury.      Ensure secure and efficient payment execution.      Liaise with banking partners for payment-related matters.      Ensure compliance with financial regulations and internal policies.      Prepare and submit financial reports as required.      Support internal and external audits related to treasury operations.      Provide expertise and recommendations for treasury strategy.      Identify opportunities to optimize cash management and financial operations.      Stay updated on industry best practices and SAP Treasury advancements.            Key requirements:        Bachelor s degree in finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or a related field (Masters degree preferred).      Proven experience (10+ years) as an SAP Treasury Expert.      In-depth knowledge of SAP Treasury Management module.      Ability to lead a team of consultants and experience in project delivery.      Strong understanding of financial instruments, risk management, and cash management.      Proficiency in financial modelling and analysis.      Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.      Attention to detail and strong problem-solving abilities.      Certification in SAP Treasury (preferred).
column11: SAP, Treasury management, Commercial vehicle, Financial operations, Cash flow, Cash management, Risk management, Project delivery, Forecasting, Financial modelling

column2: Accountability for work product of the team - daily trade, position, Swap MTMs, and cash reconciliations to the prime broker / custodians/administrators as well as all income / expense accruals. In addition, overseeing timely reconciliations and settlements of OTC products.      Playing an active oversight role in day-to-day operations, escalation of aged breaks, business-as-usual troubleshooting and setting direction and goals for individuals.      Coordinating with investment managers, prime brokers & administrators to resolve day-to-day exceptions, as well as develop more strategic initiatives.      Liaising with other internal functions like pricing, middle office and collateral management to resolve discrepancies and/or respond to internal queries.      Assisting the team and playing a review role for the accounting close (monthly / bi-weekly); providing adequate support for outstanding breaks, and preparation of month-end binder.      Working with the team in NY and locally to define strategy and newprojects, including prioritizations.      Providing assistance to auditors and fund administrators during the audit and NAV finalization process.      Working with technology teams as needed, by assisting in special projects, developing bespoke reports, developing specifications, product implementation and UAT.          What you'll need:          The ideal candidate must have an MBA (Finance) / CFA / CA or any another equivalent qualification.      6-9 years of work experience in fund accounting      In-depth domain / finance knowledge, attention to detail, the ability to work with minimal supervision and experience in managing high performers.      Drive to enhance the efficiency of processes      Strong project management skills and effective managerial ability      strong communication and collaboration skills      Proficiency in MS Excel.
